Name_2: A FedEx Cessna 208 Caravan lifted during storm with 95 mph winds almost this plane‚Äôs rotation speed
Text_2:
FedEx Grand Caravan at Eppley the plane tipped over due to 95 mph winds which is almost this plane‚Äôs rotation speed.

Severe thunderstorms in Nebraska left nearly 200000 customers in the Omaha area without power overnight Friday according to reports.

Wind gusts as strong as 90 mph downed trees and power lines sometimes onto cars and caused property damage.

Small planes were blown upside-down according to photos shared on social media.

Severe thunderstorm warnings were issued for several counties across the state on Friday and a severe thunderstorm watch remained in effect for Douglas County which includes Omaha until 5 a.m. CT.

Name_4: Kamala Harris is mocked for claiming rural residents can't get photocopies of their IDs
Text_4:
Vice President Kamala Harris is facing criticism after suggesting that people who live in rural areas aren't able to make photocopies because they don't have a Kinkos or OfficeMax nearby.

Harris made the remarks in an interview with BET News on Friday as part of an argument against voter ID laws including those in some states that require a photocopy of ID to vote by mail.

'I don't think that we should underestimate what that [compromise on voter ID laws] could mean' Harris said.

'Because in some people's mind that means you're going to have to Xerox or photocopy your ID to send it in to prove who you are. Well there are a whole lot of people especially people who live in rural communities who don't - there's no Kinkos there's no OfficeMax near them' she added.

Vice President Kamala Harris is facing criticism after suggesting that people who live in rural areas aren't able to make photocopies because they don't have a Kinkos or OfficeMax

Kamala Harris absurdly says it‚Äôs ‚Äúalmost impossible‚Äù for rural Americans to photocopy their ID pic.twitter.com/J94IuGBFLv ‚Äî RNC Research (@RNCResearch) July 10 2021

'Of course people have to prove who they are' Harris said but 'not in a way that makes it almost impossible for them to prove who they are.'

The remarks drew mockery from some on Twitter who said that they were able to make photocopies despite living in rural areas.

'I live on top of a mountain on the WV/VA border and I can photocopy my ID. I mean I do it while moonshining White Lightning while dueling banjos play in the background but I can still do it' one person tweeted.

'I grew up in a rural community without an OfficeMax or a Kinkos and I managed to successfully make photocopies of things on many occasions' another wrote.

Another critic called the claim 'insulting and untrue' and added 'Bottom line: Kamala you need to start forgetting all about 2024 before the Democrats do it for you.'

Others pointed out that the Kinkos brand has not existed for 17 years since the chain merged with FedEx.

Harris' remarks come as Congress fiercely debates a proposal to pass a sweeping Democratic bill on elections which would create universal mail-in voting and same-day registration in every state among many other changes.

Congressional Democrats are facing renewed pressure to pass their bill after a Supreme Court ruling Thursday made it harder to challenge Republican states that pass election security laws that make it harder to vote.

House Speaker Nancy Pelosi called the ruling an 'unprecedented assault' that 'greenlights the brutal accelerating campaign of voter suppression.'

Speaking in Florida President Joe Biden said he would have 'much more to say' soon but largely sidestepped comment.

For their part Republicans show no sign of willingness to engage with Democrats on the issue.

'The states created the federal government and it¬¥s not up to Chuck or Nancy or anyone else in Washington D.C. to tell Arizona or anyone else how they should conduct an election' Arizona Attorney General Mark Brnovich who was a party in the case said on Fox News.
Name_5: Experience pays off for Jim Furyk the new U.S. Senior Open champion
Text_5: Furyk became the 10th player and second in a row after Steve Stricker in 2019 to win the U.S. Senior Open in his debut. He joined an illustrious group to have won both the U.S. Senior Open and U.S. Open which he captured in 2003 at Olympia Fields near Chicago. That group includes Billy Casper Hale Irwin Orville Moody Jack Nicklaus Arnold Palmer Gary Player and Lee Trevino. Irwin was the most recent to capture the double with the first of his two Senior Open titles in 1998.

Name: Fifth Third Bank
Name_1: Atlanta United 2 falls 1-0 vs. Sporting KC II
Text_1:
Atlanta United 2 lost 1-0 versus Sporting KC II Saturday night at Fifth Third Bank Stadium. Jonantan Villal made his debut for ATL UTD 2 while Alexander Garuba earned his first start of the season.





After a tough battle between the two clubs in the first half hour SKC II scored the game‚Äôs lone goal in the 38th minute. Enoch Mushagalusa received the ball outside the 18-yard box from a corner kick on the left side. The forward then turned and dribbled inside the box before firing a shot that took a deflection on its way into goal.





ATL UTD 2 began the second half by dominating possession. After a long spout of possession in the 78th minute the ball found its way to Aiden McFadden in the right flank where he served a lobbed ball into the six-yard box. Danial Sebhatu rose up and headed the ball on frame but Kendall McIntosh denied him to keep it a one-goal game.





Atlanta continued to push on in search of an equalizer. In stoppage time Connor Stanley drove across the top of the box and found Darwin Matheus near the right corner of the box. The forward fired a low bending ball to the left corner of the goal but the keeper made the save.





ATL UTD 2 (3-5-5 14 points) will return to action against Louisville City FC on July 17 at Lynn Family Stadium (ESPN+ 7:30 p.m. ET).

ATL UTD 2 is owned and operated by AMB Sports & Entertainment and is the United Soccer League (USL) affiliate of Major League Soccer‚Äôs Atlanta United. ATL UTD 2 joined USL for its expansion 2018 season and plays its home matches at Fifth Third Bank Stadium in Kennesaw Georgia.
Name_2: Recap: Sporting KC II earns gritty 1-0 road win over Atlanta United 2
Text_2:
Sporting Kansas City II (3-7-4 13 points) secured their second straight road win on Saturday night as Enoch Mushagalusa bagged a sensational solo goal to spark a 1-0 victory over Atlanta United 2 (3-5-5 14 points) at Fifth Third Bank Stadium in Kennesaw Georgia. Goalkeeper Kendall McIntosh made two impressive late saves to collect the clean sheet and extend Atlanta‚Äôs winless run to six matches.

Head coach Paulo Nagamura deployed a Sporting KC II lineup that notably featured two sets of brothers: midfielders Cam Duke and Christian Duke started together in a professional match for the first time ever while twins Jahon Rad and Kaveh Rad were also selected to a lineup that boasted six Sporting KC Academy products and six MLS players on loan from Sporting Kansas City.

A pair of Academy graduates combined for Sporting KC II‚Äôs first chance in the seventh minute. Right back Kayden Pierre blistered his way down the right flank and delivered a low cross into the box for forward Wilson Harris who forced Atlanta goalkeeper Ben Lundgaard into a strong save.

The visitors drew first blood in the 38th minute thanks to a sublime individual effort from Mushagalusa. The 21-year-old winger received a short corner kick from Jahon Rad did brilliantly to slither past Alexander Garuba and Bradley Kamdem Fewo and toe-poked a shot that deflected into the top corner beyond the outstretched Lundgaard. Mushagalusa now leads SKC II with five goals this season three of which have come against Atlanta at Fifth Third Bank Stadium after he bagged a brace in a 2-2 draw between the teams on June 9.

Mushagalusa nearly went from scorer to provider in the 52nd minute galloping free of the Atlanta defense and squaring the ball from the right side of the box but Harris‚Äô close-range strike lifted over the crossbar with the gaping net at his mercy.

Newly signed Sporting KC II forward Jamil Roberts who on Saturday night was also nominated for Best Play at the 2021 ESPYS for his NCAA championship-winning goal with Marshall University in May earned his professional debut as a second-half substitute. The Englishman almost marked his maiden appearance with a world-class goal however his 28-yard thunderbolt rattled the woodwork and skipped out of play.

SKC II held Atlanta without a shot on target until the 78th minute when substitute Danial Sebhatu planted a powerful header on frame prompting Mcintosh into a phenomenal reflex save. The hosts had another last-gasp attempt go begging four minutes into second-half stoppage time as McIntosh dove right to cast aside Darwin Matheus‚Äô speculative strike through traffic.

Name_2: Tesla launches project to build sustainable solar community in southeast Austin
Text_2:
‚ÄúNeighborhood solar installations across all housing types will reshape how people live‚Äù said Tesla CEO Elon Musk.

Example video title will go here for this video

Example video title will go here for this video

AUSTIN Texas ‚Äî The nation's most sustainable community in the southeast neighborhood of Easton Park near William Cannon Drive and McKinney Falls Parkway ‚Äì that's what Tesla Energy Brookfield Asset Management and real estate developer Dacra want to do with SunHouse at Easton Park.

The developers said the project will have sustainable features installed in phases to allow for ongoing learning and innovation.

Brad Chelton is the Texas President for Brookfield Residential.

"It's pretty ambitious" Chelton said.

Besides the Tesla solar tiles he said it's Teslas' Powerwall 2 battery storage that makes this technology feasible.

"Typically historically solar you make power during the daytime when you may not need it because people are at work or school things like that. But then when you need it the sun's not shining in the evening. What the battery does kind of solves for that" Chelton said.

Tesla CEO Elon Musk said "neighborhood solar installations across all housing types will reshape how people live."

Dacra CEO Craig Robins said "our goal is to establish that fully sustainable neighborhoods are not only viable but the best practical and economical choice."

All of which makes Easton Park resident Lateef Johnson just a little bit excited.

"I own a fitness business. I'm a personal trainer. A lot of my clients own Teslas. And I asked them 'Hey is it really you know what it's cracked up to be?' And every single one of them has had such great things to say about you know owning a Tesla. So putting that aside to now know that brand is attached to the neighborhood that I live in. And it wasn't like 'I chose Eastern Park because of that. It's just I'm living here.' And that's a part of what the next phases are. As you mentioned the future of Easton Park is so freaking cool" Johnson said.

Chelton said the prices of homes range from mid- to upper $300000 for 1400- to 1500-square-foot-size homes and $500000 to $600000 for 2700- to 2800-square-foot homes.

The first phase which is around a dozen or so homes go on sale next month. He said those should be complete by the end of the year.

The neighborhood will be developed on land in Brookfield Residential‚Äôs Easton Park master-planned residential community in southeast Austin but will be designed and marketed separately according to the release.

Sustainable features include Tesla V3 solar roof tiles and Powerwall 2 battery storage installed at homes in the community. The community will also incorporate EV charging stations in each home.

Developers anticipate residents of these homes will produce sufficient energy to supply daily needs and reduce the daily demand on the electric grid. Residents will be provided with backup storage in the event of a power outage and potentially could be compensated for returning power to the energy grid.

The first phase of installation began in June with a sampling of homes under construction. The initial installations will provide insight and information on product integration which will guide the installation at the next phase of significantly more homes the developers said.

‚ÄúThe City of Austin is excited for the arrival of these affordable options to housing powered by renewable energy‚Äù said Austin Mayor Steve Adler. ‚ÄúI am excited for the Tesla Brookfield and Dacra partnership‚Äôs approach to sustainable energy and housing as an example of the out-of-box thinking that continues to make our community a beacon of innovation for the rest of the country and world.‚Äù

Homebuyers are invited to register their interest with the Easton Park team.
Name_3: How Palm Springs CCA Desert Community Energy's first year budget went
Text_3:
With expenditures exceeding revenues Desert Community Energy cut costs in its first year of operation by making its signature Carbon Free plan less green and eliminating a subsidy that provided cleaner energy to low-income customers.

Desert Community Energy launched in Palm Springs in April 2020 with the goal of providing greener power and more control over electricity sources ‚Äî at an additional cost of about 10% ‚Äî for former Southern California Edison customers.

But cash flow issues and the new program's need to build a reserve have prompted Desert Community Energy to reduce the renewable energy content of its Carbon Free product which is possible because hydropower is considered "carbon-free" but not renewable.

Desert Community Energy's move to scale back renewable energy content combined with its already higher rates than Southern California Edison has former Desert Community Energy board member and Cathedral City Mayor Raymond Gregory questioning how the cooperative is benefitting customers.

"There really is very little to do [to further cut costs] except maybe make the green carbon-free mix even less green; if that happens at what point are people going to keep paying a premium for energy that is less green? The other option is to raise rates but then you get to the point of why even have DCE when the people getting green energy are paying much much more than they could under Edison's green rate" Gregory said.

DCE faced cash flow issues in first year

Desert Community Energy is a locally controlled nonprofit community choice aggregator or CCA. CCAs are local entities that have the authority to purchase electricity and sell it to their customers. The CCA still uses Edison‚Äôs wires to transmit electricity but Desert Community Energy chooses the plans that it offers and says it focuses on renewable energy sources such as wind and solar.

Facing cash flow issues DCE missed a payment due to Southern California Edison in February and took out a $2 million line of credit to help pay the bill which must be repaid by the end of this year.

DCE representatives say a combination of factors has led to cash flow issues including higher energy costs delinquent customer payments the COVID-19 pandemic and the typical challenges of building up a fund reserve for a new program.

The actual budget for July 2020 through May 2021 shows that DCE spent $32251519 on power while bringing in $31772122 in revenue. DCE's total power and operating costs were $34013682 creating a gap of about $2.2 million between expenditures and revenue.

After implementing cost-cutting measures and as DCE's long-term power agreements come online DCE's finances are looking up for the 2021-22 fiscal year. In the recently passed 2021-22 budget DCE anticipates bringing in $46356669 in revenue and spending $43637474 on power procurement and operating costs with a net surplus of $2719195.

Other CCAs haven't fared as well during the pandemic. Western Community Energy which covers the cities of Eastvale Hemet Jurupa Valley Norco Perris and Wildomar declared a fiscal emergency and filed for bankruptcy in May. In June Western Community Energy deregistered and transferred its customer accounts back to Southern California Edison.

Western Community Energy said it decided to deregister as it became apparent that it would not have sufficient financial resources to continue to purchase power for its customers going into July.

Emissions reductions equal 20000 cars off the road

When Desert Community Energy launched all customers were automatically placed in the greener and more expensive Carbon Free plan with the ability to opt down into the less-expensive less-green Desert Saver rate or to opt out of Desert Community Energy entirely and stick with Southern California Edison.

As of May 2021 about 88% of DCE's Palm Springs customers have chosen to stay with Desert Community Energy with about 80% of those customers staying on the Carbon Free plan. Out of 42407 eligible customers 3198 have opted down to Desert Saver and 5148 or about 12% have opted out of Desert Community Energy entirely.

Desert Community Energy board members and staff say emissions reductions show that the program was a success in its first year.

Desert Community Energy estimates that in the past year customers on the premium Carbon Free plan have reduced greenhouse gas emissions at the equivalent of taking 20000 cars off the road.

And a recent assessment of the city's greenhouse gas emissions found that Palm Springs' 2020 greenhouse gas emissions are projected to be about 16% below 2010 levels. This exceeds California's target of reducing statewide greenhouse gas emissions to 1990 levels by 2020 which would be the equivalent of Palm Springs reducing its emissions by 15% from 2005-10 levels by 2020 according to the assessment by environmental consulting firm PlaceWorks.

Without Desert Community Energy the city would have had a nearly 5% increase in greenhouse gas emissions over the same time period.

"The program is actually having more of an impact on greenhouse gas emissions than I thought we'd get so I'm really thrilled about the impact we've had" said Geoff Kors a Palm Springs city councilmember and Desert Community Energy board chair.

Will other cities enroll accounts in DCE?

The idea to form Desert Community Energy started with a vote by the Coachella Valley Association of Governments' Executive Committee. CVAG then partnered with the Western Riverside Council of Governments which includes 18 cities and the Morongo Band of Mission Indians to research its options.

Because those jurisdictions were on a different timeline than CVAG Desert Community Energy became a collaboration between Palm Springs Cathedral City and Palm Desert. But in March 2020 Cathedral City voted to withdraw from the program which became effective July 1.

In April 2020 the Palm Desert City Council considered a motion to leave Desert Community Energy but decided to stay in the electricity program without enrolling residents or municipal accounts into the program. This means that Palm Desert residents currently don't have the choice of opting into Desert Community Energy.

Gregory said DCE's current financial situation shows that Cathedral City was "very wise" to withdraw from the program.

"The main reason we left is we just felt really simply that the return did not justify the risk. Of course others felt that getting the green energy was worth it and there wasn't much risk" the mayor said. "But Cathedral City was correct there is substantial risk and of course what's happened with DCE is playing that out."

But Palm Desert councilmember and DCE board member Sabby Jonathan disagrees.

"I think DCE overall has been an outstanding success for Palm Springs. There are certainly challenges and factors beyond our control having to do with Southern California Edison and the grid and the regulators and so forth. But you cannot ignore the impact on our environment that DCE has had in Palm Springs and that in my mind makes it a tremendous success" he said.

Jonathan said he hopes that the Palm Desert City Council will reconsider enrolling municipal or residential accounts or both in DCE during the city's next budget cycle.

"The good news is that unlike Cathedral City Palm Desert elected to remain a part of DCE and continue to have a seat on the board. ... I still have very strong hopes that our city at some point will register our municipal accounts with DCE and be in with DCE and allow our residents to have a choice that they currently do not between Southern California Edison and DCE" Jonathan said.

"I think the example and the leadership set forth by Palm Springs is in favor of our city doing the same because the results are clear the impact that they have had on the environment just in this one year alone is impressive" he continued.

Expenditures exceeded revenue in first year

Desert Community Energy started off with a $4 million surplus after selling electricity it bought in anticipation of its August 2018 launch which was pushed back due to a sudden spike in natural gas prices. But since its launch DCE has dealt with an increase in electricity costs and lower-than-expected revenue creating a gap between expenditures and revenue.

DCE sets its rates based on Southern California Edison‚Äôs rates so when Southern California Edison lowers its rates DCE does the same. According to a quarterly financial update from the March 15 Desert Community Energy Board meeting changes to Southern California Edison rates reduced DCE‚Äôs expected 2021 revenue by about $2.5 million with a forecasted impact of $5.7 million in 2022.

At the same time energy prices have gone up causing DCE to spend more on the energy it purchases for customers while receiving less in revenue from those customers.

The increased energy power prices will increase DCE‚Äôs expected costs by about $2.8 million for 2021 and $3.5 million in 2022.

Customer delinquencies also have played a role. In April 2020 DCE‚Äôs original delinquency rate was estimated to be about 0.3% but during COVID-19 that rose to 3%.

‚ÄúToday we are still holding funds in reserve and anticipate being able to continue to build those reserves that‚Äôs essentially the first step for a startup organization. And this is something that CCAs across the state are experiencing with challenges with energy costs and delinquency rates and we‚Äôre all dealing with the same circumstances‚Äù said Katie Barrows director of environmental resources at the Coachella Valley Association of Governments.

In February Desert Community Energy missed a payment due to Southern California Edison. According to a letter sent from Southern California Edison to DCE‚Äôs Board DCE failed to pay an amount due to SCE on Feb. 15 instead making a partial payment on Feb. 17. The bill was for $4 million.

‚ÄúSCE assumes this Board expects DCE to be able to adequately finance its operations and perform its contract obligations. To that end SCE asks the Board to ensure that DCE pays SCE for the remaining amount now overdue without further delay‚Äù the letter stated.

Desert Community Energy took out a $2 million line of credit in March to pay the Edison bill amid the organization‚Äôs cash flow issues.

According to CVAG spokesperson Erica Felci by February DCE had paid Edison about half of the $4 million bill. The remainder of the bill was paid off after DCE took out the $2 million line of credit and DCE has now paid Edison in full.

The $2 million line of credit must be paid off by the end of the year.

Summer 2020 heatwave drove up power costs

Kors said DCE's initial surplus allowed the agency to keep rates "artificially low" as power costs rose for DCE especially during last summer's heatwave and the power grid failure in Texas in February.

"That was challenging but it shows the benefit of this being all about people and not about profits. No money is going to any corporation or the shareholders every dollar will go back into the community and benefit the ratepayers" he said.

Kors attributes these "artificially low" rates as the main reason for the gap between DCE's revenues and expenditures.

Western Community Energy also struggled with power prices in summer 2020 ‚Äî that agency incurred an additional $12 million in energy costs that summer due to the "unprecedented heatwave which depleted supplies and drove up costs."

"We are in a very different situation than Western Community Energy" Kors said. "We had the benefit of having $4 million in reserves before we started and we are checking our budget regularly and looking at delinquencies and taking them into account and making sure we're in good financial shape."

With summer power prices up two to three times from last year DCE's board approved a rate increase of up to 4% for customers on the Carbon Free plan on July 7 in anticipation of increased summer power prices and potential significant heat events.

‚ÄúWithout a doubt CCAs across the state are facing an extremely challenging set of circumstances ‚Äî market volatility significant increases in energy prices and uncertainty about the potential for another summer heatwave. The DCE board has always taken a conservative approach when it comes to managing its finances. At the same time one of the big benefits to having a locally controlled utility is that we can quickly respond if needed to the changing circumstances which our board demonstrated just this week (with the rate increase)‚Äù Felci said in an email to The Desert Sun.

Felci noted that DCE‚Äôs practice of procuring fixed-price energy on a forward basis or in advance insulates DCE from some of the volatility of procuring energy on the short-term market.

The majority of DCE‚Äôs power for summer 2021 is expected to cost less than the prevailing market price according to Felci.

How SoCal Edison rates compare to DCE which is now cutting costs

DCE is now cutting costs to build up its reserves.

Since DCE's launch the premium Carbon Free plan has provided electricity from sources that are 100% carbon-free and 50% renewable from in-state renewable sources such as wind and solar. The Carbon Free plan costs about 10% more than Southern California Edison's base rate. The key difference between renewable and carbon-free energy is that hydropower is considered "carbon-free" but not renewable.

Desert Saver costs customers less than Southern California Edison and offers 35% renewable electricity.

In April DCE's board voted to reduce the renewable content of the Carbon Free plan to at least 35.75% renewable with 75% from in-state sources while maintaining 100% "carbon-free" content.

For comparison Edison's average energy mix came from 35.1% renewable sources in 2019 and would cost less than DCE's Carbon Free plan.

The change to the content of the Carbon Free product is expected to save DCE approximately $738608 in 2021. Desert Community Energy staff say these cost savings will allow the agency to meet its financial goals including procuring more local energy resources and developing community energy programs.

But Gregory said he's "very concerned" that even with DCE's recent steps to cut costs it won't be enough to get out of the hole.

"Even with the estimates given by experts the change in the Carbon Free product will generate $738000 in savings in a year but they're already at least $2 million in the hole and the line of credit needs to be paid off by the end of the year" he said.

And with a renewable energy content that now mirrors Southern California Edison Gregory questioned what the incentive is for customers to stick with DCE.

Southern California Edison offers a green rate with 50% renewable and an average monthly bill of about $120 or a 100% renewable plan with an average monthly bill of about $122 according to Southern California Edison.

But unlike Southern California Edison's green rate Desert Community Energy's premium plan is still 100% carbon-free.

"We're keeping the 100% carbon-free because that's what we committed to and what the city wants to see for their community. But we've made some adjustments to reduce the cost and provide some significant savings as a result" said Barrows.

In addition to changing the renewable content of the Carbon Free product the board also voted to suspend a program that allowed lower-income customers to enroll in DCE's Carbon Free plan while only paying the Desert Saver rate.

Under the program about 6500 DCE customers who participate in rate payment assistance programs were enrolled in the more environmentally friendly Carbon Free plan but were only asked to pay the Desert Saver rate with DCE subsidizing the difference. Eliminating this subsidy will reduce DCE's costs by about $120000 a year.

"Of course hindsight is always 20/20 but you look at it and think maybe they shouldn't have been so ambitious with getting everybody on the green rate and getting the most green energy you could possibly get while still paying only 10% more than Edison. ... Maybe it was too ambitious because they quickly went in the hole and didn't allow enough slack to build up any kind of reserve" Gregory said.

Power purchase agreements will save money in the long term

Even with some financial challenges DCE has achieved environmental goals in its first year such as reduced greenhouse gas emissions and long-term power purchase agreements with renewable energy projects.

In February Desert Community Energy signed three multimillion-dollar 15-year agreements with Terra-Gen LLC to purchase power from three wind farms located in Palm Springs. The power purchase agreements will allow DCE to save an estimated $7 million to $10 million over the course of the contracts.

"Given our launch in the early stages of the pandemic and all the challenges that that's meant to all of us especially customers I think we're doing great. The focus of Desert Community Energy is to provide clean energy and provide local benefits. And we've been able to do that with Palm Springs" Barrows said.

Desert Community Energy recently signed a 20-year agreement for a solar energy and battery storage project in Kern County which will begin serving DCE customers in 2023. These long-term agreements which have fixed rates will provide rate stability for DCE and its customers. For example the solar energy and battery storage agreement will cost between $13 million and $50 million less over the 20-year period than purchasing the equivalent products on the short-term market.

"I think if you looked at CCAs across the state to do [those agreements] in your first year is really great progress for us. And we're happy about that" Barrows said.

As DCE adds more long-term renewable energy agreements to its portfolio its finances are expected to turn around. By 2023 Desert Community Energy expects net revenue of about $4.5 million.

"Ultimately as we look out over the next couple of years and we think about the environmental impacts and long-term cost savings that will result I think DCE is a great program" Kors said.

"There are often challenges to doing what we can to save the planet. ... For Palm Springs health and wellness and the environment are top priorities. We're really proud of our city and even when it's hard sometimes we want to do the right thing for our residents and the well-being of the future."

Erin Rode covers the western Coachella Valley cities of Palm Springs Cathedral City and Desert Hot Springs. Reach her at erin.rode@desertsun.com.
Name_4: Watch out Tesla! This solar EV prototype promises range above 700 km
Text_4:
Solar electric vehicle maker Lightyear recently tested its Lightyear One prototype car which drove a distance of 710 km on a single battery charge of 60 kWh for almost nine hours. The EV maker says that Lightyear One is the world‚Äôs first long-range solar electric vehicle.

Solar EV maker Lightyear tests its prototype car that drove up to 710 km on a single battery charge.Lightyear will start production in the first half

The prototype car by Lightyear was taken to Aldenhoven Testing Center in Germany where it completed a drive cycle at a speed of 85 kmph. The testing was done on a single battery charge of 60 kWh. Lightyear adds that in the market today even the most efficient electric cars consume around 50% more energy at this relatively low speed. The testing ranged from validating the yield of the solar panels the energy consumption of the cooling system the battery performance the software operating the solar car and the functioning of the in-wheel motors. The EV maker stresses that the concept of a long-range solar car is a huge opportunity to change mobility as one can drive for months without charging.

Also Read : This small electric truck gives Wall-E vibes

The co-founder and CEO of Lightyear Lex Hoefsloot notes that this is the company's important engineering and technological milestone as the performance of the electric car validates the former's patented technology. ‚ÄúThis prototype has over 440 miles of range with an energy consumption of only 137 Wh/Mile at 53 miles an hour. This milestone is a great confirmation of the scalability of our business model. We are confident that in the coming months we will be able to reach a similar level of energy consumption at highway speed. Lowering the energy consumption per mile of an EV means that you can provide a lot of range on a small battery" he adds. Hoefsloot also explains that adding solar cells to low-energy consuming cars can be an advantage as it can gain about 45 miles of charge on a sunny day.

Also Read : Audi teases electric vehicle concepts; hints at three different upcoming models

The company shares that an exclusive series of 946 Lightyear Ones will go into production in the first half of 2022 and it also wants to explore the mass market segment from 2024.

Name: Fiserv
Name_1: Could the Fiserv Forum floor bring good luck to the Bucks?
Text_1:
MILWAUKEE ‚Äî When fans watch a Milwaukee Bucks game they‚Äôre likely not thinking too much about the hardwood court the team is playing on.

What You Need To Know The maple wood used for the hardwood floor in Fiserv Forum came from the Menominee Tribe



The tribe has more than 230000 acres of sustainable forest for lumber



They replant every tree they use for lumber

The Menominee Tribe in Wisconsin though does.

‚ÄúIt‚Äôs a real big deal for the tribe‚Äù said Nels Huse Millwork Specialist with Menominee Tribal Enterprises.

Wood from their maple trees were used to make the floor of Fiserv Forum.

‚ÄúAbout 90% of the product that comes off the forest floor the sawmill will process for various uses including the wooden floors that are used on the basketball courts by Prostar and other floor makers‚Äù said Pershing Frechette Plant Manager at Menominee Tribal Enterprises.

The tribe‚Äôs wood gets used for a lot of different things. Their forest has produced wood for the floors for Fiserv Forum the Bucks‚Äô practice facility and the court for the Wisconsin Herd.

‚ÄúWe have cut our 230000 acres over five different times with increasing the volume by two by not reducing anything at all‚Äù said John Awonohopay with Menominee Tribal Enterprises.

They work diligently to make sure only the trees ready to become lumber are the ones that get cut down.

They‚Äôre also meticulous about replanting everything they use.

‚ÄúWhen we cut the Bucks‚Äô trees here just in 2018 for these floors we cut those trees and when they came out of the woods we were planting the next group of trees that would be ready in 80 or 90 years‚Äù Huse said. "That‚Äôs pretty impressive to me.‚Äù

The tribe also did a prayer ritual when the Bucks got the wood for their floor - a prayer to Mother Earth.

Hal Koller the President of ProStar Surfaces who used the wood to make the floor said that might bring some ‚Äúmagic‚Äù to the NBA Finals.

‚ÄúWe‚Äôre hoping. We‚Äôre hoping there‚Äôs magic in the fact that now they‚Äôre on native timber and now that luck carries through and some of the maybe the spirits of the Menominee who were part of this history of Wisconsin forever come to play here‚Äù Koller said. "We‚Äôre out of the desert back in the Northwoods I hope it makes sense!"
Name_2: Bucks Dominate First NBA Finals Game At Fiserv Forum
Text_2:
Already in these playoffs the Milwaukee Bucks have come back from 0-2 to win a series. They‚Äôre a step closer to accomplishing the feat again after beating the Phoenix Suns in Game 3 of the NBA Finals on Sunday 120-100.

The Bucks have lost just once at Fiserv Forum these playoffs while the Suns had dropped just two road games before Sunday.

The teams were evenly matched in the first quarter. Deandre Ayton opened the scoring for Phoenix finishing the quarter with 12 points including a couple of jumpers for the 6-foot-11 big man. Meanwhile Giannis Antetokounmpo recorded five rebounds and four assists for Milwaukee. Head coach Mike Budenholzer said Antetokounmpo did a little bit of everything on Sunday.

Stay informed on the latest news Sign up for WPR‚Äôs email newsletter. Email Comments This field is for validation purposes and should be left unchanged.

‚ÄúHe‚Äôs just doing whatever it takes to help his team to help us. He‚Äôs in an aggressive mindset. He always plays that way‚Äù he said.

The Bucks moved the ball well in Game 3 finishing the contest with 28 team assists. But after 12 minutes the Suns had a tight 3-point lead.

It was the second quarter when the Bucks got into trouble in Game 2 with the Suns eventually winning 118-108 after pulling away before halftime.

Phoenix aimed to replicate that success in Game 3 ‚Äî going on an 8-0 run to put the Suns up by 6 points before Milwaukee took a timeout. Brook Lopez ended their streak with a dunk and then his team went on a run of its own.

Milwaukee Bucks‚Äô Brook Lopez (11) dunks against Phoenix Suns‚Äô Deandre Ayton (22) during the first half of Game 3 of basketball‚Äôs NBA Finals in Milwaukee Sunday July 11 2021. Paul Sancya/AP Photo

The Bucks dominated in the paint and just a few minutes later they had their own 6-point lead fueled by a 20-6 run. The Bucks finished the first half up 60-45 thanks to a couple of corner 3-pointers from fan favorites Bobby Portis and P.J. Tucker.

Khris Middleton capped off the half with a couple of made free throws after drawing a foul on Ayton ‚Äî his third of the game. Middleton went into halftime with a quiet 15 points ‚Äî a big improvement from the 11 he scored in Game 2.

Ayton had another foul against Antetokounmpo early in the second half and he came out of the game. Meanwhile Antetokounmpo shot relatively well from behind the line finishing the game making 13 of 17 free throws.

The Suns pulled within 4 points in the third quarter with the help of Jae Crowder who made six 3-pointers and finished the game with 18 points for Phoenix. The veteran player was on the Miami Heat team that bounced the Bucks from last year‚Äôs NBA bubble. Crowder has a history in Milwaukee having played at Marquette.

But the Bucks never let them get too close and Milwaukee finished the third quarter with a 98-67 lead thanks to 16 consecutive points. Bucks fans enjoyed the final quarter without much stress.

Milwaukee Bucks‚Äô Giannis Antetokounmpo (34) dunks during the first half of Game 3 of basketball‚Äôs NBA Finals against the Phoenix Suns Sunday July 11 2021 in Milwaukee. Aaron Gash/AP Photo

The Suns didn‚Äôt get enough help Sunday from star Devin Booker who finished the game with just 10 points after making seven 3-pointers in Game 2. He only played 29 minutes after struggling in Game 3. But Budenholzer said he doesn‚Äôt think Booker will stay down for long.

‚ÄúHe‚Äôs a great challenge: keeping him off the free-throw line keeping him off the 3-point line. I‚Äôm sure he‚Äôll be ready to go and we‚Äôve got to match that going into next game‚Äù he said.

Antetokounmpo led scoring for Milwaukee with 41 points. It was his second consecutive 40-point game and only his third game back from a knee injury suffered in the Eastern Conference finals.

‚ÄúHe‚Äôs a great play maker he‚Äôs a great passer he‚Äôs a great screener. He just does so many things and I think when he‚Äôs conscious of doing a little bit of everything he‚Äôs very capable and that‚Äôs when he‚Äôs at his best‚Äù Budenholzer said.

Jrue Holiday made big shots at key moments for the Bucks. He finished with 21 points.

Sunday marked the first time Milwaukee has hosted an NBA Finals game in almost 50 years. About 18000 fans watched from inside Fiserv forum with thousands more gathered outside. Fireworks exploded in the Deer District after the game.

Game 4 is set for Wednesday in Milwaukee. Tickets are available starting at $395.

Name_4: Fiserv Forum Deer District security preps for Bucks homestand
Text_4:
The NBA Finals come to Milwaukee on Sunday July 11 ‚Äì the Bucks hosting the Phoenix suns in Game 3.

The team hopes to rebound at home after dropping the first two games of the series in Phoenix and fans are not losing hope. Thousands will be out for the first Finals game in Milwaukee in nearly 50 years and safety and security will be top of mind for local law enforcement.

"Welcome to the NBA Finals ‚Äì in Milwaukee Wisconsin" said Bucks President Peter Feigin.

2021 NBA Finals sign inside Fiserv Forum.

The Suns may as well plant to set in Milwaukee as enthusiasm builds ‚Äì tens of thousands of fans planning to come out to witness history in action for Game 3.

Fans and security are planning a huge welcome home for Giannis Antetokounmpo's return to action at Fiserv Forum for the first time since hyperextending his knee during the Eastern Conference Finals.



"We will be sold out inside we will be packed with 25000 plus people outside and we will have a global audience of hundreds of millions which will be really really exciting for this city for this brand for this team in such a big way" said Feigin.



The entire area ‚Äì Fiserv Forum the Deer District and beyond ‚Äì is secure and ready for the throngs of fans expected.

"I‚Äôm confident in our ability here and the fact that we‚Äôve all been in kind of ready mode since the DNC which was here in Milwaukee just a year ago. So we‚Äôre ready and prepared. We‚Äôre looking forward to it" Milwaukee County Sheriff Earnell Lucas said.

FREE DOWNLOAD: Get breaking news alerts in the FOX6 News app for iOS or Android.

Businesses hotels and vendors will also be ready to show off the "not so terrible" city of Milwaukee like never before.

"This is a moment in time when the focus of world sports is on us where we will have thousands of people visiting whether they be the media whether they be visiting fans whether they be our global fans around the country it‚Äôs just an unbelievable opportunity to really welcome these people with open arms" said Feigin.



Sheriff Lucas said he will be rooting for this to end with a win and a championship parade down Wisconsin Avenue in a week or so.

Name: Ford Motor Company
Name_1: Amazon to be first tenant at Brook Park's ex-Ford site
Text_1:
Greater Cleveland‚Äôs next Amazon distribution center will be the first phase of a sprawling industrial park that will rise on the site of two shuttered Ford auto plants in suburban Brook Park (Clay Corp.).

CLICK IMAGES TO ENLARGE THEM

Northeast Ohio‚Äôs transition away from an economy of heavy industries continues as the first tenant is revealed for the former Ford Motor Co. engine and casting plants in the Cleveland suburb of Brook Park. That tenant according to two sources familiar with the redevelopment is e-commerce giant Amazon.

The 210-acre Ford Motor Brook Park Target Industrial-Advanced Manufacturing Campus as the city calls it will involve a multi-phase redevelopment of the 1.7-million-square-foot Ford Engine Plant No. 2 and its neighboring Cleveland Casting Plant site.

In their place will be millions of square feet of warehousing logistics/shipping and light-industrial facilities representing a half-billion-dollar investment to serve what so far has been an insatiable market.

Once Ford‚Äôs remaining buildings on the site (not including the still-active Engine Plant No. 2) are cleared away new road sewer and utility infrastructure will be built. Then multiple new buildings will be constructed to serve big-name tenants offering thousands of jobs. Amazon represents only the first phase the sources said.

The 210-acre Ford Motor Brook Park Target Industrial-Advanced Manufacturing Campus is anticipated to add millions of square feet of new industrial and distribution facilities employing thousands of workers (Google/KJP).

Developing the site is a partnership of Weston Inc. of Warrensville Heights the DiGeronimo Cos. of Independence and Scannell Properties of Indianapolis IN. They created a joint venture called DROF BP I LLC (spells ‚ÄúFord‚Äù backwards and ‚ÄúBP‚Äù referring to Brook Park) which purchased the 210 acres of land in April for $31.5 million according to county records.

All three partners have experience in developing Amazon delivery stations and other distribution centers for other clients. In Northeast Ohio Weston built a 168750-square-foot speculative building in 2019 at 10801 Madison Ave. in Cleveland. NEOtrans was first to report Amazon would retrofit and lease the building from Weston. DiGeronimo Companies‚Äô Independence Construction was the building contractor.

In 2015 Scannell and DiGeronimo joined forces in redeveloping the Twinsburg Chrysler Stamping Plant that closed in 2010 into the Cornerstone Business Park. Among the buildings constructed was a 248000-square-foot Amazon distribution center representing an investment of $17 million.

When Brook Park‚Äôs two Ford plants closed in 2007 and 2012 nearly 3000 well-paid union workers and others lost their jobs. The casting plant was demolished in 2013. Its neighbor at 18300 Snow Rd. will soon follow said Brook Park Mayor Michael D. Gammella in his Summer 2021 newsletter to Brook Park residents.

Interior of an Amazon distribution center which is highly automated. But most centers employ hundreds if not thousands of workers inside the facility and in trucks and vans outside each Amazon distribution facility (Clay Corp.).

‚ÄúShortly you will see demolition crews leveling the old engine plant and aluminum foundry‚Äù he wrote. ‚ÄúIn its place will be a new building for a major corporation. Other new buildings will follow with even more new companies. This mega project will bring thousands of new jobs into our city. It is the beginning of a new era and there is more to come.‚Äù

‚ÄúThe project will absolutely be transformational to the region‚Äù said TJ Asher president of Weston‚Äôs Acquisitions and Development in a written statement. ‚ÄúWe‚Äôre looking forward to tapping into the potential this property offers and developing a unique commercial area with the potential for significant job creation and economic impact for Northeast Ohio.‚Äù

Asher called it a once-in-a-generation redevelopment project due to its scale and location. It is next to Cleveland Hopkins Airport Interstates 71 and 480 busy mainline railroads of Norfolk Southern and CSX Transportation and is within a 20-minute walk of the Greater Cleveland Regional Transit Authority‚Äôs Red Line rail transit station on Brookpark Road.

The project will respond to strong market demand. Real estate firm Newmark recently reported that Greater Cleveland‚Äôs industrial market achieved a new low 4.5 percent vacancy rate in first-quarter 2021 with 2.9 million square feet under construction. In the region‚Äôs southwest submarket that vacancy rate was even lower ‚Äì a mere 3 percent.

END
Name_2: Watch: Design-for-manufacturing and light-weighting move to the top of the agenda
Text_2:
This livestream investigates how designers and engineers at Ford Gestamp and key suppliers are using innovative materials and creating light-weight architectures including for models like the Ford F-150 Lightning and Maverick compact truck.

Register or Login to watch full video

Reducing weight in vehicle structures and components has taken on a new level of importance with the shift to electric powertrains and a growing focus on sustainability in manufacturing. Addressing this challenge designers and manufacturing engineers have a range of proven and emerging materials to work with that offer the required combination of strength and low weight for body structures and exteriors whilst there are an increasing array of options for sustainable light-weight materials and technology for interiors. Optimising the material mix design and application in a vehicle‚Äôs architecture is a key factor both in the performance of electric cars and in maintaining efficient low-carbon production.

These opportunities in materials combined with compressed development time for new vehicles are also requiring much closer collaboration across vehicle design engineering and production than ever before. Design teams are more closely integrated with production engineers across an OEM and key suppliers and are using tools such as rapid prototyping digital simulation and virtual reality to test and validate structures and changes for production.

This livestream Hour brought to you by Car Design News and Automotive Manufacturing Solutions features leading designers engineers and materials specialists at Ford Gestamp SSAB and ArcelorMittal presenting case studies on recent vehicle launches and innovation on light-weighting and materials and in a panel discussion.

Two leading designers from Ford Elvir Mesalic and Scott Anderson provide exclusive insight into light-weighting considerations and innovations in two of the carmaker‚Äôs most important new vehicle models the electric pickup Ford F-150 Lightning and the new Ford Maverick hybrid compact truck. In both cases lead Ford designers worked closely with engineering teams to bring material and light-weighting innovations to the exterior and interior and make sure they were optimal for production as well.

Paul Belanger director of Gestamp‚Äôs North America R&D Center provides insights on the automotive supplier‚Äôs advances in body and materials engineering.

Specialists at steel suppliers SSAB and ArcelorMittal meanwhile discuss materials processes and digital tools for light-weight body construction and materials application in automotive manufacturing.

This episode features the following segments of interviews presentations and panel discussions:

Minutes 0.00 - 6.00 ‚Äì Insight on the drivers and challenges for light-weighting vehicles for car design and manufacturing ‚Äì Christopher Ludwig and Nick Holt AMS

Minutes 6.00 - 15.30 ‚Äì How Ford used design-for-manufacturing to light-weight interiors and simplify production processes for the Maverick truck ‚Äì Scott Anderson Ford

Minutes 15.30 - 25.00 ‚Äì Designing and integrating the ‚ÄôMega Frunk‚Äô in the F-150 Lightning including engineering and manufacturing challenges ‚Äì Elvir Mesalic Ford

Minutes 25.00 - 32.00 ‚Äì Q&A with Scott Anderson and Elvir Mesalic Ford

Minutes 32.00 - 46.00 ‚Äì Optimising design and manufacture for high-strength steels ‚Äì Robert Str√∂m SSAB

Minutes 46.00 - 58.00 ‚Äì Strengthening body structures with light-weight materials ‚Äì Paul Belanger Gestamp

Minutes 58.00 - 74.00 ‚Äì Optimising body-in-white structures and manufacturing ‚Äì J√©r√¥me Favero ArcelorMittal

Minutes 74.00 - 107.00 ‚Äì Panel discussion

Scott Anderson Lead Interior Designer SUVs and Trucks Ford Motor Company

Paul Belanger Director North American R&D Center Gestamp

Name_4: Rivets Join Morgan Motor's Unique Vehicle Assembly Method
Text_4:
Ask the typical American about automobile history and you‚Äôre likely to hear the name ‚ÄúHenry Ford.‚Äù Pose the same question to a Brit however and get ready for an answer of ‚ÄúMorgan Motor Co. (MMC).‚Äù

While it‚Äôs true that the Ford Motor Co. is six years older MMC‚Äôs history is nothing to trivialize. Founded in 1909 MMC is well known for expertly combining traditional craftsmanship and just-enough modern technology to build wonderful sports cars

High-volume production is not a priority at Malvern UK-based MMC as the company only builds about 800 cars per year. What is most important is handcrafting unique and iconic automobiles out of the finest materials.

One such material is ash wood which the company uses for the frame of each vehicle. Other important core materials are leather and aluminum.

In 2000 MMC introduced its Aero 8 vehicle the first to feature an aluminum frame. Nearly 20 years later the manufacturer developed an aluminum platform for its Plus Six vehicle. This platform offers a 100 percent increase in torsional stiffness when compared to the traditional steel chassis in the company‚Äôs Plus 8 vehicle which preceded the Plus Six.

Assembling the Plus Six platform did initially present a joining challenge. But MMC solved the problem by using RIVSET self-pierce-riveting technology from the B√∂llhoff Group.

The RIVSET joining method is a two-step process. First the individual aluminum parts to be joined are bonded with a special adhesive. As the adhesive hardens the semitubular RIVSET rivet is punched through the top material layer and adhesive and into the bottom material layer where it forms an undercut and a slight button-shaped protrusion. Because the bottom material layer is not punched through a gas- and liquid-tight spot joint is created.

MMC engineers like that the procedure does not require predrilled holes and that it can join similar and dissimilar materials of more than two layers. In this case for example the adhesive is the intermediate layer. Most importantly the technology creates long-lasting high-strength mechanical joints.

Some 440 RIVSET rivets are used to assemble the platform and hundreds more for the Plus Six body. B√∂llhoff‚Äôs RIVQUICK blind rivets and RIVKLE blind rivet nuts are also used for the body due to its high-strength-design requirements. Overall a total of 1610 B√∂llhoff fasteners are used in each Plus Six car.

Two variations of the standard RIVSET technology have been introduced in recent years. One is the Automation E (electric hybrid) rivet installation head which improves joining functionality flexibility and availability with minimum maintenance. Typical process time is less than 1.5 seconds per rivet.

Designed for applications ranging from prototyping to large-scale production Automation E can install rivets in high-strength steel having a tensile strength of up to 1600 megapascals.

The head can be attached to a six-axis robot and runs entirely on electricity. Compressed air or hose couplings are not required. Its open-software interface enables robot communication and data acquisition via an OPC UA server.

Also available is a cordless electro-hydraulic Portable C tool that digitally sets and controls installation pressure. The tool automatically informs the user when the target pressure is reached and the process cycle is completed. If target pressure is exceeded the tool issues a visual and audible alarm. Base units provide force levels of 10 to 50 kilonewtons or 40 to 80 kilonewtons.

For more information on self-piercing rivets call 260-347-3903 or visit www.boellhoff.com.
Name_5: 2021 Ford F-150 Blacks Ops Lifted Truck Flaunts Huge Tires Fox Shocks
Text_5: Imposing from every angle the lifted pickup also boasts Fox 2.0 performance shock absorbers a BDS lift kit robust cross members for maximum clearance and a heavy-duty skid plate for extra underbody protection.The IFP design of the shocks eliminates oil aeration thus enabling maximum performance from the precision valving. Developed for great ride quality and the roughest off-road conditions imaginable these mono-tube shocks are manufactured from CNC-machined 6061-T6 billet aluminum.Each build features recalibrated tire sensors and a recalibrated speedometer for good measure along with a front-end alignment. Tuscany Motor further sweetens the deal with XL power boards that benefit from rock guards and lights a powder-coated performance exhaust system with dual tips black door cladding with Black Ops badges and genuine fender vents.A full-metal front bumper is also worthy of note along with an integrated LED light bar and a cutout of the Black Ops name right under it. These upgrades are complemented by the color-matched hood with mesh vent inserts that allow fresh air to enter the engine bay. Unfortunately for truck enthusiasts Tuscany Motor hasn‚Äôt modded the powertrain of the half-ton rig.The reason the EcoBoost V6 or Coyote V8 remain stock is reliability . More to the point every Black Ops is covered by three years or 36000 miles (57936 kilometers) of warranty for extra peace of mind. As far as the interior is concerned tinted windows hide embroidered patches on the headrests embroidered carpeted floor mats as well as carbon-fiber trim. The finishing touch comes in the guise of a limited-edition serialized plaque.

Name: Fox Corporation
Name_1: Tucker Carlson is 'furious' at Fox News executives for not supporting his NSA spying claims sources say
Text_1:
CNN Business ‚Äî

Tucker Carlson is furious with Fox News executives for not vigorously defending him amid his evidence-free claims that the National Security Agency spied on him in a conspiracy to destroy his TV show according to people familiar with the matter.

One of the sources described Carlson as ‚Äúfurious‚Äù with network executives especially the public relations team ‚Äúfor not backing him up.‚Äù

‚ÄúTensions are sky high‚Äù the person said.

Another source pointed out that Carlson has ‚Äúalways had tension with‚Äù management but said right now he‚Äôs ‚Äúextra pissed.‚Äù

Carlson has complained to colleagues and associates about what he perceives as a lack of support.

Two Fox News spokespeople did not respond to requests for comment over the weekend.

In a text to a CNN reporter Sunday night Carlson called the allegation that he is angry with Fox executives ‚Äúabsurd.‚Äù

‚ÄúI‚Äôm not mad at anyone at Fox‚Äù he said. ‚ÄúIf I was I‚Äôd say so. I‚Äôm mad at you for lying relentlessly. What a loathsome person you are. Please print that.‚Äù

For the better part of two weeks Carlson ‚Äî the highest-rated host on Fox ‚Äî has repeatedly claimed that the Biden administration was spying on him.

Fox pointedly has not covered his claims on its newscasts even though such an intrusion would normally be a significant news story. Fox has not shown any outward signs of investigating Carlson‚Äôs claims either.

Carlson originally attributed his information to a ‚Äúwhistleblower within the U.S. government who reached out to warn us.‚Äù He said ‚Äúthe NSA the National Security Agency is monitoring our electronic communications and is planning to leak them to take this show off the air.‚Äù

However Carlson who has a history of pushing conspiracy theories has offered no proof of his allegations.

The NSA in a rare move even issued a statement saying Carlson is not the target of any investigation and that the agency had no intention of forcing him off the air.

One week later Carlson claimed that Biden‚Äôs NSA has leaked the contents of his emails to other members of the media. One of the banners on his show said ‚ÄúNSA LEAKED TUCKER‚ÄôS EMAILS TO JOURNALISTS.‚Äù

Ordinarily a TV network would be quick to denounce such a thing if it actually happened. But Fox News executives have been noticeably silent during the back and forth.

Suzanne Scott the network‚Äôs chief executive and Jay Wallace the network‚Äôs president have not issued any statements of public support for Carlson nor have they condemned the NSA for the massive abuse of power Carlson alleges.

Lachlan and Rupert Murdoch who control Fox Corporation have also been silent on the matter.

When Axios reported that Carlson‚Äôs spying claims came after he sought an interview with Russian President Vladimir Putin ‚Äî raising the prospect that his emails were intercepted in the course of US intelligence efforts ‚Äî Fox issued a vague and terse statement.

‚ÄúWe support any of our hosts pursuing interviews and stories free of government interference‚Äù an unnamed network spokesperson told Axios.

One of the sources said Carlson viewed that statement as wholly insufficient.

On the other hand Carlson‚Äôs show operates almost like its own planet removed from the vetting and oversight that applies to normal cable news shows.

That may be why other Fox programs have largely avoided covering Carlson‚Äôs allegations on air ‚Äî a sign that management doesn‚Äôt know if the claims are legitimate.

Fox‚Äôs Maria Bartiromo also known for promoting conspiracy thinking is one of the exceptions ‚Äî she has brought up Carlson‚Äôs claims repeatedly.

Saturday night host Jesse Watters also framed an entire segment around Carlson over the weekend ‚Äî but he did it in the form of a question asking ‚ÄúIs Tucker Carlson being spied on by the Biden administration?‚Äù
Name_2: Fox News‚Äô planned 24-hour weather channel has climate experts worried
Text_2:
Fox News Media the company that owns the reactionary climate crisis-skeptical Fox News is launching a weather channel this year ‚Äì a development that has climate crisis experts worried.

Fox Weather a 24-hour channel devoted to all things meteorological promises ‚Äúcutting-edge display technology‚Äù according to a press release with ‚Äúforecasting experts surrounding every major weather event‚Äù.

But it is Fox News‚Äô output and the potential for Fox Weather to adopt a similar tone to its sister channel that has onlookers concerned. Hosts on Fox News have spent years rubbishing or undermining the idea of manmade climate breakdown and the fact that two Fox News-linked executives are behind the weather channel launch doesn‚Äôt bode well.

‚ÄúFox News has access to and is highly trusted by a wide range of conservative Americans ‚Äì which is precisely the audience that least well understands the serious threats that climate change poses to the safety security and health of all Americans‚Äù said Edward Maibach director of George Mason University‚Äôs Center for Climate Change Communication.

‚ÄúIf Fox chooses to use its access and credibility to inform viewers about the realities of climate change and its impacts on the weather it could be a game changer. Conversely if it opts to perpetuate misinformation to advance political goals it will be a huge disservice to all Americans ‚Äì conservative liberal and moderate‚Äù Maibach said.

Last year Tucker Carlson rubbished the idea that forest fires on the west coast were a result of climate crisis ‚Äì serious climate scientists however agree that the fires are very much linked to the breakdown ‚Äì and suggested environmental hazards were a liberal conspiracy.

Carlson‚Äôs colleague Laura Ingraham has insisted contrary to experts‚Äô findings that the planet is in a ‚Äúnatural‚Äù cycle of warming and suggested that environmental activists like Greta Thunberg had been ‚Äúbrainwashed‚Äù while Sean Hannity said the left‚Äôs ‚Äúobsession‚Äù with the climate was a ‚Äúpolitical tool‚Äù.

‚ÄúThe danger of [Fox News Media] running a weather channel is that if they pervert news about the weather anything like how they‚Äôve perverted news about climate change and energy politics millions of Americans will be further misled about this crisis‚Äù said Geoffrey Supran research fellow at Harvard University‚Äôs department of the history of science.

‚ÄúIt‚Äôs been shown that the most important predictors of public support for climate action are understanding that this crisis is real human-caused serious and solvable‚Äù Supran said.

‚ÄúIf as I and I‚Äôm sure others fear [Fox News Media‚Äôs] weather channel downplays the links between global warming and extreme weather it will only solidify their viewers‚Äô existing biases against climate action.‚Äù

The tenor of Fox News hosts‚Äô commentary matches with data from Public Citizen a non-profit thinktank. In 2019 Public Citizen found that in the first half of the year Fox News devoted 247 segments to climate crisis. Of those ‚Äú212 (86%) were dismissive of the climate crisis cast warming and its consequences in doubt or employed fearmongering when discussing climate solutions‚Äù Public Citizen reported.

View image in fullscreen Donald Trump supporters protest a climate crisis summit in Des Moines Iowa in 2019. Photograph: Stephen Maturen/Getty Images

‚ÄúFox News has been a powerful engine of climate misinformation for years ‚Äì so powerful in fact that its influence has been named the ‚ÄòFox News Effect‚Äô‚Äù Maibach said.

‚ÄúOne of our studies for example showed that before Fox News began its attack on the Green New Deal most conservatives supported its core policy proposals. Six months later ‚Äì after Fox had relentlessly attacked it and its sponsors ‚Äì support for those proposals dropped to near zero among frequent Fox viewers.‚Äù

Fox Weather has already poached meteorologists from around the country according to the New York Times including the Weather Channel‚Äôs ‚Äúsenior weather product architect‚Äù Shane Brown. The channel based in New York City will be advertiser-funded and stream 24 hours a day.

Sharri Berg formerly the executive vice-president of news operations for the Fox News channel will oversee Fox Weather along with Suzanne Scott CEO of Fox News Media. In announcing the channel last year Berg said ‚Äúweather is a vital component to news‚Äù.

‚ÄúCombining our trusted reporters and expert meteorologists from Fox News and [Fox Television stations] nationwide the Fox Weather products will be built to serve our audiences in a customized fashion‚Äù Berg said.

A Fox Weather spokesperson pointed the Guardian to a statement given to the New York Times:

‚ÄúWith a dedicated team of leading meteorologists and experts stationed across the country Fox Weather will provide in-depth reporting surrounding all weather conditions and we are excited to showcase to viewers what a full-service comprehensive weather platform can deliver beginning this fall.‚Äù

If Fox Weather does not interfere with the weather information its new staff is putting out then Maibach said there is hope ‚Äì for the weather channel at least.

‚ÄúI don‚Äôt expect that Fox News will change its ways or its views about climate change anytime soon but Fox Weather has the opportunity to get the facts right. Let‚Äôs hope it chooses to‚Äù Maibach said.

Viewers will have to wait and see what approach Fox Weather takes but in the meantime there is serious concern given the damage the American right has already done to efforts to mitigate the climate crisis.

‚ÄúWe‚Äôve already seen the ways in which 40 years of disinformation in the United States has stifled both climate action and the narrative around climate‚Äù said Lily Gardner a community organizer with the Sunrise Movement a youth-led organization which aims to stop climate crisis.

‚ÄúNancy Pelosi [the Democratic House speaker] and Newt Gingrich [a Republican former House speaker] went from releasing an ad together in 2007 that indicated that they were interested in working on climate policy to climate becoming a deeply partisan issue in which the facts are debated as opposed to the solutions.‚Äù
Name_3: Billionaires descend on Sun Valley in private jets to talk about climate change
Text_3:
A cabal of some of the most high-profile people in media finance and technology descended on Idaho‚Äôs resort town of Sun Valley in private jets this week to tackle among other things climate change.

On Tuesday the day the conference kicked off traffic from private jets got to be so busy that the Federal Aviation Administration temporarily banned planes on the West Coast from taking off.

The FAA told Fox News it briefly held planes on the ground at their departure airports to avoid congestion in the airspace around Sun Valley.

The manager of the Friedman Memorial Airport in the neighboring town of Hailey Idaho told NPR ahead of the conference that he expected more than 90 private planes.

A session preaching the perils of climate change to people who flew to the event on their own carbon-emitting Gulfstream jets rankled some business leaders that FOX Business contacted earlier in the week.

"Talking climate change on his private jet?" one CEO remarked with a laugh referring to Gates.

One Twitter used pointed out the "Climate Hypocrisy."

BARRY DILLER DECLARES THE MOVIE INDUSTRY DEAD ‚ÄòWILL NEVER COME BACK‚Äô: REPORT

The private conference hosted by the private investment bank Allen & Company has been held in July every year since 1983 with the exception of last year due to the pandemic.

The event is largely a summer camp for some of the world‚Äôs billionaires. Notable attendees this year included Amazon founder Jeff Bezos Facebook CEO Mark Zuckerberg and Microsoft co-founder Bill Gates whose public image has taken a hit in recent months over his divorce announcement and reported ties to disgraced financier Jeffrey Epstein.

CLICK HERE TO READ FOX BUSINESS ON THE GO

The event concluded on Saturday with a closing speech by billionaire Warren Buffett.

FOX Business' Charles Gasparino and Eleanor Terrett contributed to this report.

Name_5: Mark Zuckerberg slides in to Sun Valley in shorts and $35 flip flops a day after Trump sued him
Text_5:
Advertisement

Jeff Bezos and his girlfriend Lauren Sanchez were spotted on Thursday arrving at the annual Sun Valley conference in Idaho dubbed the 'billionaire summer camp'.

Bezos 57 was spotted at the relaxed gathering of titans from industry media sport and technology dressed down in a polo shirt and light blue pants with white sneakers.

Sanchez 51 looked summery in a flowing skirt and a sun hat in a video captured on Thursday by FOX Business Network. The two were spotted walking hand-in-hand with smiles on their faces.

Reporters shouted questions at Bezos about his impending trip to space but the Amazon founder ignored them and carried on walking into the venue.

Bezos has announced that he will become the first passenger to fly into space with his space tourism company Blue Origin on July 20.

Jeff Bezos and his girlfriend Lauren Sanchez were spotted on Thursday arriving in Idaho

Bezos a lifelong space enthusiast has been racing against fellow billionaires Richard Branson and Elon Musk to be the first of the three to travel beyond Earth's atmosphere before making the trip back.

Branson is set to blast into space on July 11 - nine days ahead of Bezos.

The billionaire space race is fueled by optimism that space travel will become mainstream as nascent technology is proven and costs fall fueling what UBS estimates could be a $3 billion annual tourism market by 2030.

Blue Origin and Virgin Galactic as well as Musk's SpaceX have also discussed using their rockets to link far-flung global cities.

Blue Origin named the New Shepard program after astronaut Alan Shepard who was the first American to fly into space exactly 60 years ago.

A mystery bidder has paid $28million at auction for a seat onboard the first crewed spaceflight by Blue Origin.

The person will fly on July 20 with Bezos and his brother Mark.

Blue Origin founder Jeff Bezos inspects New Shepard's West Texas launch facility before the rocket's maiden voyage in West Texas on June 7

Bezos and Sanchez who began dating in 2019 attended that year's Sun Valley conference together.

The meeting has been useful for Bezos: it is reportedly where in 2013 he sealed his deal to buy The Washington Post.

Bezos already the world's wealthiest man has set a new record for personal net worth by topping $211 billion.

Bezos 57 gained $8.4 billion in net worth on Tuesday alone according to the Bloomberg Billionaires Index as Amazon stock soared 4.7 per cent on the Pentagon's announcement that it is canceling the $10 billion JEDI contract with Microsoft.

It vaulted Bezos above the previous record of $210 billion held briefly in January by Tesla CEO Elon Musk who has seen his fortunes decline and now holds a mere $181 billion putting him in distance second after Bezos.

While Tesla stock has declined nearly 10 percent so far this year Amazon shares have continued to soar adding 15.4 percent since January 1.

Amazon's soaring shares have boosted the fortunes of Bezos who on Monday stepped down as chief executive of Amazon handing over the reins to his experienced lieutenant Andy Jassy.

Bezos now takes over the role of executive chairman at Amazon. He still owns about 51 million shares of Amazon stock a position that makes up the vast majority of his wealth.

Philanthropist Bill Gates Apple CEO Tim Cook Walt Disney Company chair Bob Iger and fashion designer Diane von Furstenberg also made their appearances on the third day of the annual 'billionaire summer camp' in the resort town of Sun Valley Idaho on Thursday.

Mark Zuckerberg Facebook founder cut a casual figure as he conferred with Facebook COO Sandberg.

The two were photographed on the same day that a bombshell New York Times report claimed that their relationship has been strained due to disagreements that arose during Donald Trump's presidency.

According to the Times Zuckerberg usurped some of Sandberg's duties as she lost influence in Washington DC after Trump's shock victory over Hillary Clinton in the 2016 general election.

Sandberg who is active in Democratic Party politics and fundraising saw her influence within the company diminish as Facebook felt pressure to prove to conservatives that it did not have a liberal bias according to the Times.

Amazon's soaring shares have boosted the fortunes of Bezos who on Monday stepped down as chief executive of Amazon handing over the reins to his experienced lieutenant Andy Jassy.

Gates who announced in May that he is divorcing his wife of 27 years Melinda French Gates was seen at the Sun Valley conference with Evan Greenberg the president and CEO of global insurance giant Chubb Limited.

The tech executives did not appear all too concerned on Thursday just a day after former President Trump announced a class action lawsuit against the social network and other platforms including Twitter and YouTube which is owned by Google parent Alphabet.

Trump revealed the action against Facebook Twitter and Google's YouTube along with the companies' Mark Zuckerberg Jack Dorsey and Sundar Pichai at a press conference Wednesday in New Jersey where he demanded that his accounts be reinstated.

Trump has been suspended from the platforms since January when his followers violently stormed the Capitol building trying to block Congress from certifying Joe Biden's presidential win.

The companies cited concerns that Trump would incite further violence and have kept him locked out.

All three declined comment on Wednesday.

'We're asking the US District Court for the Southern District of Florida to order an immediate halt to social media companies' illegal shameful censorship of the American people' Trump said of the filings.

'We're going to hold big tech very accountable.'

Twitter Facebook and Google are all private companies and users must agree to their terms of service to use their products.

Under Section 230 of the 1996 Communications Decency Act social media platforms are allowed to moderate their services by removing posts that for instance are obscene or violate the services' own standards so long as they are acting in 'good faith.'

The law also generally exempts internet companies from liability for the material that users post.

On Wednesday Apple CEO Tim Cook Warren Buffett Diane Von Furstenberg and husband Barry Diller were among those spotted arriving for day two of the conference where the estimated wealth of attendees surpasses $700 billion the equivalent of the GDP of Saudi Arabia.

Big names and moguls in tech business film and media have been descending on Sun Valley a tiny resort town in rural Idaho for the annual five-day conference put on by Allen & Company.

Buffett the 90-year-old CEO of Berkshire Hathaway was spotted on Wednesday being escorted to the conference in a golf cart.

Belgian fashion designer Diane Von Furstenberg 74 and her IAC chairman husband Barry Diller 79 strolled in together for one of the conference's morning sessions.

Diller was pictured on Thursday alongside CNN host Anderson Cooper who is a close family friend of Von Furstenberg. The fashion designer was a well known friend of Cooper's late mother socialite Gloria Vanderbilt.

Others who were spotted arriving for the day two events included Snap Inc.'s Evan Spiegel Rupert Murdoch's ex-wife Wendi Deng ViacomCBS Chair Shari Redstone and Alice and Olivia CEO Stacey Bendet.
