Name_5: Why is the US considering a digital dollar?
Text_5:
Cash transactions are increasingly rare. More than half of transactions in the US involved cash in 2010. The number had dropped to 28% in 2020 even before the Covid-19 pandemic which led to wider adoption of cashless and contactless payment among businesses.

But going cashless means a heavier reliance on private companies‚Äîbanks credit card companies payment processors‚Äîall of which have delays and fees that hit poor people hardest. At the moment a cash-free economy would exclude the 7.1 million Americans or 5.4% of US households that are unbanked meaning they do not have a checking or savings account at a bank or credit union according to the FDIC‚Äôs most recent study in 2019.

Advertisement

That has the US Federal Reserve thinking about backing its own digital version of cash. A Fed-backed digital dollar would in theory function like cash‚Äîwithout delays processing fees or onboarding requirements‚Äîand could usher unbanked or underbanked Americans into the digital economy. Citizens could send cash digitally to one another or swipe a government debit card to pay and that money would live in a Fed-backed wallet outside of the private banking system.

Building a central bank digital currency (CBDC) carries risk for failure hacking or breaches of personal privacy but if the Fed can bring a digital dollar online it could make the digital economy much quicker more efficient and more accessible to those who need it most.

The digital divide is growing

Right now the US digital payment system relies heavily on the private sector. That has its downsides. Interest rates can hit hard if balances are not paid off (The average US credit card balance was about $5900 at the end of 2020). Banks charge overdraft fees if a person takes out more money from a checking account than they have. And while some apps like Venmo and Zelle allow people to easily transfer money between one another digitally they are still largely linked to bank accounts with multi-day processing delays‚Äîor fees for instant deposits.

What‚Äôs missing say digital currency advocates is a public option free of fees delays and hassles.

Advertisement

The Fed revealed last summer that after years of in-house research it had partnered with the Massachusetts Institute of Technology to ‚Äúunderstand the opportunities and limitations‚Äù of a CBDC. The project is set to release its findings later this summer the next step before the Fed decides if and how to implement a new currency.

‚ÄúIt‚Äôs very expensive to be unbanked and participate in the digital economy‚Äù

Neha Narula who is leading Project Hamilton the name of the Fed-MIT collaboration told lawmakers on June 9 that a digital dollar offered a ‚Äúground up redesign of our payment systems‚Äù in the US. Skeptics like Republican Sen. Pat Toomey pushed back on the idea that a CBDC is necessary arguing a CBDC would turn the Fed into a retail bank and claiming that the private sector does the job well enough.

But Narula sees the opportunity as revolutionary. ‚ÄúIf we were able to create a well-designed interface to a central bank digital currency we could do for the transfer of value what the internet did for the transfer of information which is create a platform for innovation‚Äù she said at the recent hearing.

Advertisement

Access to the US financial system should be a public good said Hanna Halaburda a professor at NYU‚Äôs Stern School of Business and a former senior economist at the Bank of Canada. ‚ÄúA lot of central banks have a mandate to provide a means of transaction that would be free and accessible to everyone‚Äù she told Quartz. That‚Äôs a reality for cash but there is no digital equivalent at the moment.

üéß For more intel on the digital dollar listen to the Quartz Obsession podcast episode on the future of cash. Or subscribe via: Apple Podcasts | Spotify | Google | Stitcher.

The Digital Dollar Project a research group pushing for a CBDC in the US said that inclusion is the number one priority. The project is a partnership between the consultancy Accenture and the Digital Dollar Foundation a nonprofit co-founded by Christopher Giancarlo the former chair of the Commodity Futures Trading Commission (CFTC).

Advertisement

‚ÄúIt‚Äôs very expensive to be unbanked and participate in the digital economy‚Äù said David Treat a director of the Digital Dollar Project and a senior managing director at Accenture. ‚ÄúAs we make more and more advancements in the digital economy that divide is just growing.‚Äù

The US isn‚Äôt leading the way

The US is not the first country to consider a digital currency. In fact it‚Äôs a bit behind the pack. More than 60 countries and jurisdictions are currently researching or deploying their own digital tender according to the website CBDC Tracker run by Boston Consulting Group.

The Bahamas already introduced its Sand Dollar China is testing its digital yuan and Sweden is testing an e-krona among others.

The motivations are different for each country. In developing countries where populations have less access to reliable and affordable banking CBDCs could be transformative. For those sending money across borders digital currencies could rapidly speed up the process which is notoriously tricky and intermediated by different banks and dynamic exchange rates.

Advertisement

In many nations central bankers see digital currencies as a way to keep their currency dominant. ‚ÄúOn both digital currency and payments we in Europe must be ready to move as quickly as needed or risk an erosion of our monetary sovereignty ‚Äî something we cannot tolerate‚Äù Bank of France Governor Francois Villeroy de Galhau Villeroy said at a recent conference.

Digital dollars versus cryptocurrency

One of the biggest questions is whether an official digital currency should be set up in the same way as cryptocurrency. Private cryptocurrencies like bitcoin and ether rely on blockchains decentralized ledgers that record real-time transactions across many computers. A digital US dollar would not necessarily need to.

That poses fundamental questions for America‚Äôs Federal Reserve. Will a digital dollar be run by the commercial banks or the Fed itself? Will there be a physical card associated with it so it can be inclusive of users who do not have access to broadband or a smartphone?

Halaburda said most central bank proposals right now don‚Äôt rely on a blockchain in part because there are limitations and costs associated with many different computers replicating the same transactions. Narula told lawmakers that she too doesn‚Äôt believe the system would necessarily need to be based on blockchain but said it must be encrypted in some way. The Digital Dollar Project meanwhile is considering various architectures but believes that a distributed ledger system would offer the most robust security. It is testing a series of pilot programs for a US-based CBDC and is building Sweden‚Äôs e-krona on distributed ledger technology.

Advertisement

At the moment this leaves more questions than answers.

A more secure system

The downsides of a digital dollar revolve almost entirely around two issues: privacy and security.

Unlike cash a digital system can be hacked. There‚Äôs no physical barrier to lifting copious amounts of digital currency. A digital currency system would be an obvious target for hackers which could put Americans‚Äô data and finances at risk. But Narula says there are ways to secure the system for example by making it open source with an open API. ‚ÄúI‚Äôm a firm believer that open-source software is critical for security‚Äù she said. ‚ÄúThe more people who are looking the more likely you are to find bugs and to find problems.‚Äù

And a digital currency also presents a new way for the state to monitor its citizens. In China the digital yuan is a technological advancement a way to divorce Chinese currency from the wide reach of the US financial system and another way for the state to expand its reach. That‚Äôs less of a concern in the US says Treat of the Digital Dollar Project since Americans‚Äô constitutional rights shield them from financial surveillance without due process.

Advertisement

But it will not be easy to convince some members of the Fed that these barriers can be overcome. Fed vice chair Randal Quarles for example said on June 28 that CBDCs could be a ‚Äúdeluded craze‚Äù informed by America‚Äôs ‚Äúcenturies-long enthusiasm for novelty‚Ä¶ susceptibility to boosterism and the fear of missing out.‚Äù He jokingly likened a digital currency to the parachute pants fad of the 1980s warning of the real risks of such a system like hacking. ‚ÄúThe potential benefits of a Federal Reserve CBDC are unclear‚Äù he said. ‚ÄúConversely a Federal Reserve CBDC could pose significant and concrete risks.‚Äù

But other Fed members are more enthusiastic about it. Fed board member Lael Brainard offered a much rosier view for embracing innovation while Fed chair Jerome Powell said he remained open to the idea of a digital dollar.

When CBS News asked him in April if the Fed is likely to implement a digital dollar Powell simply said ‚Äúit‚Äôs possible‚Äù but he has acknowledged ‚Äúit‚Äôs more important to get it right than to be first.‚Äù

Name: Uber
Name_1: Beginner's Guide to Uber
Text_1:
Since its launch in 2012 Uber has become the most recognized alternative to traditional taxi cabs. Uber is available in more than 700 cities around the world and this number will only increase. Whether you're traveling to Seattle Dubai Tokyo London Paris Montreal Chicago or another major metro center you can expect Uber rides to be available.

Visit the Uber web site to check if Uber is in your city or a city you plan to visit.

Uber Facts

Uber is not a taxi service. Drivers cannot pick up riders off the street. Instead Uber is a car-for-hire service that relies on smartphone technology to dispatch drivers and manage fees. Also unlike taxi services Uber drivers do not possess special licenses; rather they use their personal vehicles to offer discounted fare rides.

Uber's smartphone app takes care of the entire ride-hailing and payment process. Use your credit or debit card to pay right in the app with no need for cash.

You must be 18 years or older to have an Uber account and use the service. In the United States Uber drivers must be at least 21 years old have at least one year of licensed driving experience and drive an acceptable four-door vehicle.

Uber is designed so that the rider doesn't need to carry cash. However you can tip with cash if you prefer not to add the tip via the app.

How Uber Works

Uber is intended to be easier than using a taxi. Here's how the Uber process works.

Before Using Uber

Install the app on your smartphone and create an online Uber account. You'll provide information about the credit card you plan to use to pay for rides so you never need to bring or handle any cash.

When You Need a Ride

When you need a ride use the app to tell Uber your pickup location. You can choose from a variety of ride-type options; the most common is UberX. Alternately you can select Uber Pool if you are willing to share the ride and save some money. (More on Uber ride tiers below.)

Uber will locate drivers in your area find a driver for you and tell you how many minutes away your driver is. Rides are commonly three to 10 minutes away in major centers.

Uber will alert you when the ride has arrived. The Uber app will show you the driver's details such as name photo and type of car so you know what to look for.

During and After the Ride

Enjoy your ride. The app handles payment so just step out of the car when you arrive at your destination and thank your driver. You'll be asked via the app to rate your driver on a scale of 1 to 5 (politeness safety cleanliness). Similarly the driver rates you from 1 to 5 (politeness). You have the option of adding a tip.

The entire trip is tracked through the Uber app for accountability and ease.

S3studio / Getty Images

Why People Love Uber

Uber's appeal revolves around the trifecta of price quality and convenience.

Price

Taxicab drivers hate Uber because Uber undercuts their fees by up to 50 percent but this of course is one reason riders love using Uber. Plus Uber drivers don't require tips and can't pressure you for them; as mentioned you can add them later in the app. Taxi drivers on the other hand typically expect at least a 15 percent tip at the time of payment. You can also use Uber Pass which is essentially a subscription to Uber that gives you discounted rides.

Bear in mind however that Uber does impose surge pricing for peak events such as major sporting matches holidays like New Year's Eve and even busy weekend evenings. Fees can climb significantly for a few hours. As a rule though Uber rides are still cheaper than taxi cabs.

Quality

Uber cars tend to be cleaner newer and better-smelling than many taxis. The accountability built into the Uber app motivates drivers to keep their cars in good shape. Because Uber drivers are rated by every passenger every day there is the incentive to be both prompt and safe.

Convenience

The payment process is easy and stress-free. Likewise the app frees you from the often frustrating process of hailing a cab. The ability to handle all these details right from your phone saves time and aggravation (and keeps company and driver overhead low).

Because Uber is attractive for drivers to join the number of available drivers usually results in very fast response times. While this certainly does vary the typical Uber rider gets a pickup within three to 10 minutes of hailing while taxis can take 30 to 45 minutes after being called.

Tempura / Getty Images

Service Tiers

Uber offers a range of service tiers spanning from single riders and groups up to executive limo services.

UberX is the cheapest and most commonly used form of Uber. Vehicles are ordinary four-door models that fit up to four riders. Fares are about half the price of taxis in major cities.

Uber Pool offered in some cities allows you to share your ride with another person and split the cost. UberXL can accommodate six passengers using an SUV or minivan; it's more expensive than UberX. Uber Comfort is for riders who are constantly on the go and want a little extra comfort. Uber Select is a premium ride in a high-end car.

Uber's highest-tier services include Uber Black luxury rides with professional drivers and Uber Black SUV which offers luxury rides for six people.

In some cities Uber even offers Uber Espanol for Spanish-speaking riders Uber Assist if a rider needs extra help and Uber Wav for wheelchair-accessible rides.

Debenport / Getty Images

Driver and Passenger Ratings

Part of Uber's appeal is that drivers are under tremendous pressure to deliver pleasant safe prompt and clean experiences for passengers. Every passenger rates every driver on every trip and drivers are required to maintain an average customer rating of 4.6 out of 5.0. (Minimums vary by city.) Uber deactivates drivers who fall below this standard.

Uber does not disclose this to passengers directly but every driver gets to see your rating when deciding whether to pick you up. And yes every driver rates you right after you leave the Uber vehicle at the dropoff point. This is to protect future drivers from having to deal with rude violent aggressive and drunk/impaired passengers. If your rating is too low Uber can bar you from using the service temporarily or permanently.

To encourage kinder gentler Uber rider behavior (stop slamming doors!) the app displays rider ratings right underneath names in the Uber app's menu.

Horrocks / Getty Images

Becoming an Uber Driver

In large cities taxi cab drivers pay $500 to $1200 per month to their parent companies and municipalities. This cost includes dispatch and administration services and any additional fees the taxi company chooses to levy on its drivers.

Uber does not charge any of these monthly fees to its drivers making Uber very attractive for amateur drivers. Uber requires that drivers:

Are at least 21 years old

Have at least one year of licensed driving experience (three if you are less than 23 years old)

Possess a clean driving record

Have no criminal record

Drive an insured car that is less than 15 years old

Your car must:

Have a clean title (not salvaged reconstructed or rebuilt)

Not be a rental unless it's from an approved Uber lender

Not have damage missing pieces commercial branding or taxi signage

Uber will confirm all these details with the appropriate authorities. Uber will also do a background check looking for serious infractions such as excessive speeding driving while intoxicated and other criminal offenses.

In short if you're an honest person safe driver and reliable worker with a newer four-door car you can be an Uber driver within two weeks or so.

Engel / Getty Images

Happy Ubering

Uber's success has spawned other similar services such as Lyft Curb and Sidecar but Uber remains the most popular. In fact Uber is so common that expressions such as "getting an Uber" and "Ubering" in various languages have become commonplace.
Name_2: DJ Khaled Lookalike Uber Driver Has All His Catchphrases Mastered
Text_2:
One of the interesting phenomenons about the world is Doppelg√§ngers‚Äî somebody who looks a lot like someone completely unrelated to them. It‚Äôs even more fascinating when both people sound the same. That‚Äôs what happened to an unsuspecting person who got in an Uber with a DJ Khaled lookalike.

On Saturday (July 11) TheShadeRoom posted footage on their Instagram of an Uber driver that looked just like DJ Khaled. The Uber riders couldn‚Äôt keep their laughter in or believe their eyes at how much their driver looked like DJ Khaled‚Äôs twin. They were even more blown away when the driver used Khaled‚Äôs ‚Äúanother one‚Äù and ‚Äúbless up king‚Äù catchphrases.

View this post on Instagram A post shared by The Shade Room (@theshaderoom)

The driver‚Äôs resemblance to DJ Khaled was so real that fans in TheShadeRoom‚Äôs comment section were convinced the Miami native picked up a new job. Even Rick Ross shared a laugh in the comments after seeing his friend‚Äôs doppelganger.

AD AD LOADING... AD

‚ÄúDam I really thought that was him‚Äù wrote one person.

Another fan wrote ‚ÄúHow much y‚Äôall wanna bet DJ Khaled is about to find this man and put him in his next video.‚Äù

While DJ Khaled gets mistaken for an Uber driver J. Cole played one in the music video for Bas‚Äô new single ‚ÄúThe Jackie‚Äù featuring the Dreamville leader and Lil Tjay.

AD AD LOADING... AD

related news J. Cole Plays A Janky Uber Driver In Bas‚Äô ‚ÄòThe Jackie‚Äô Video w/ Lil Tjay & Mark Phillips July 9 2021

In the John Tashiro-directed clip Cole picks up Bas and his lady as an Uber driver in a car fully equipped with treats drinks and more.
Name_3: The Storms of Jeremy Thomas review ‚Äì Mark Cousins rides shotgun with uber-producer
Text_3:
Ninety minutes at the sweet trolley of pure cinephilia is what‚Äôs on offer in director Mark Cousins‚Äôs madly ‚Äì even outrageously ‚Äì indulgent documentary-riff about the life and career of celebrated English film producer Jeremy Thomas an elegant independent spirit in a corporate world. Thomas is a veritable auteur of auteurs the godfather-slash-midwife-cum-creative enabler to some of the most exciting movies of the past 40 years including Bertolucci‚Äôs The Last Emperor Cronenberg‚Äôs Crash Roeg‚Äôs Bad Timing and many more (though I would have liked a mention of Matteo Garrone‚Äôs freaky Tale of Tales).

Cousins affectionately calls him ‚Äúthe prince‚Äù in his voiceover in tribute to Jeremy being Brit-cinema royalty: he is respectively son and nephew of directors Ralph Thomas and Gerald Thomas (of Doctor and Carry On fame). Cousins wackily frames his film as something between a home movie and a road movie riding shotgun in Thomas‚Äôs sleek Alfa Romeo as the producer brings him along on his annual five-day car journey down through France to the Cannes film festival. And on the way he chats to Thomas about life the movies and everything while interspersing this with clips from Thomas‚Äôs films and interviews with his many admirers and colleagues including Tilda Swinton and Debra Winger.

It has to be said this is hardcore movie-mad immersion and prose-poem free-associating targeted at the cinema faithful and very much a festival event. And for those who are not used to Cousins‚Äôs style and inimitable vocal presence and perhaps hoping for more talk from the man in the title it could be a bit too much to take. Anyone coming to this film hoping for some nuts-and-bolts insight into what a producer actually does and the ever-present worries about money will be disappointed. This film floats free from that sort of banal consideration. But as always I find myself considering that in a world where everyone‚Äôs a cynic and an ironist Cousins‚Äôs unaffected rapture is unique and refreshing. And there is an odd-couple comedy here with Cousins as the unstoppably garrulous super-fan and Thomas as the reticent English gentleman almost like a charismatic Cambridge don on the long vacation who has picked up a voluble hitchhiker.

Perhaps Thomas a model of charm and self-effacement (which of course conceals a hypervigilant creative alertness) is unused to being at the centre of attention for all his iconic status: normally he is a couple of steps to one side as the director a Bernardo Bertolucci or a Takashi Miike basks in the limelight. But that is a position he relishes. Ironically film is not a medium that really captures the subtlety and intimacy of Jeremy Thomas‚Äôs personality. Showbusiness is full of bigmouth showoffs claiming to be ‚Äúshy‚Äù. But Thomas is the real thing. Possibly radio would come closer.

At the end of all this Cousins makes Thomas take a word-association test. He says ‚ÄúCannes‚Äù and the producer shoots back: ‚ÄúDo‚Äù. It is the perfect producer response. A producer has got to make things happen make connections and see opportunities and Thomas says that the festival is where he has a ‚Äúline out‚Äù like a fisherman waiting for a new idea or talent to swim up. It is a pleasure to sit on the riverbank alongside him.
Name_4: Uber picks former Tesco exec to run European delivery arm
Text_4:
Uber will this week name a former Tesco executive as the head of its European delivery arm amid a frenzy of competition in the rapid grocery sector.

Sky News understands that Eve Henrikson who spent years working for Britain's biggest online grocer is joining the owner of the world's best-known ride-hailing app as regional general manager for Uber Delivery in Europe the Middle East and Africa.

The last permanent occupant of the role was Stephane Ficaja who left Uber earlier this year.

Ms Henrikson's appointment will come amid a deluge of investment in tech companies specialising in fast urban logistics.

Deliveroo which went public in London through a calamitous flotation earlier in 2021 has since seen its shares recover amid continued growth in consumer demand.

Meanwhile the likes of Getir and Gorillas which promise to deliver groceries within minutes are raising vast sums of capital to accelerate their efforts to capture market share.

Ms Henrikson said her role would include an attempt to launch "new on-demand services and adjacencies providing best-in-class customer experiences and delivering profitable growth".

Uber is expanding its delivery services into areas such as groceries retail and pharmacy products having been one of the early entrants to the restaurant delivery space through its Uber Eats operation.

It has also launched Uber Direct a delivery-as-a-service offering for corporate customers such as McDonald's.

Advertisement

Uber said it had more than doubled gross bookings for the delivery business in the first quarter of the year.

The Uber Eats app is now available in nearly 900 cities in 14 countries across the EMEA region and the second-largest player in the UK market according to the company.
Name_5: Why Offer Airport Shuttles & Transportation for Hotel Guests
Text_5:
Among hotel amenities transportation services can make or break a hotel‚Äôs appeal especially for group business. But with Uber and Lyft making it easy for travelers to access a ride with a few clicks on a phone hoteliers have more options than ever when it comes to providing‚Äîor not providing‚Äîtransportation services.

Third-Party Partnerships

Late last year the Sheraton Gateway Los Angeles partnered with National Transportation to provide shuttle service for hotel guests.

Fred DeSota director of sales and marketing at the airport hotel said the property‚Äôs team selected NTI because the company offered more options than a traditional airport shuttle. For example NTI can arrange private car service beyond the traditional round-trip rides to and from the airport and dedicated shuttles for groups to help them stay together.

Because NTI specializes in group transportation DeSota said the company can adjust quickly to special demands. In one case the hotel learned that it needed to secure eight 57-passenger buses for transfers with just hours to spare. ‚ÄúNTI was able to accomplish that for us with less than three hours‚Äô notice‚Äù he said.

Perhaps most importantly DeSota said the partnership lets guests track NTI‚Äôs shuttles. When a reservation is made either through Marriott.com or the Bonvoy app guests can schedule their transportation at the same time. ‚ÄúAny guest that has a reservation arrived at our hotel can now go onto their app and see exactly where the shuttle is [and] what the time is to their particular waypoint‚Äù he added.

Dedicated Fleet

The Country Inn & Suites by Radisson Bloomington at Mall of America next to the Minneapolis‚àíSaint Paul International Airport has four dedicated shuttles for airport transfers. Jodie Grannes regional general manager for the hotel said providing transportation provides peace of mind for guests. The wait at the airport pickup area for a ride-share could easily be 15 or 20 minutes but the longest wait for one of the hotel‚Äôs shuttles to reach a guest is 15 minutes. ‚ÄúThe average traveler we're seeing right now doesn't mind the wait‚Äù she said.

‚ÄúWe are just five minutes from the airport and we have quite a refined system of signups for the shuttle‚Äù Grannes said. The airport does not make pickups ‚Äútraveler friendly‚Äù she said with hotel shuttles limited to one dedicated area that can be hard for a passenger to find. ‚ÄúSo we have little PDFs that travelers can download off of the website or little cards they get at the front desk that directs them over and [details] on how to call us so that we can be there shortly after they arrive.‚Äù The system works well to minimize wait times she said aided by the multiple shuttles that can get to the airport quickly. ‚Äú

The hotel also helps locals flying out of the airport letting them stay for one night and leave the car at the hotel‚Äôs lot for a week. ‚ÄúThey can add additional nights if needed for a fee‚Äù she added.

Ride-Sharing

Ben Seidel president and CEO of Real Hospitality Group is not a fan of free shuttles for off-airport properties. ‚ÄúPersonally I would rather call an Uber and spend $15 to get there rather than wait for an airport shuttle to get there‚Äù he said. Shuttles can also negatively affect the guest experience if something goes wrong he added. ‚ÄúAs an operator if I'm not meeting your expectations on timeliness and you wait a minute longer than maybe you think you should then the entire guest experience is compromised.‚Äù

A good number of RHG‚Äôs customers are Marriott Bonvoy members and the loyalty program offers points for Uber rides. With the industry facing a labor shortage he said not having to build a team of drivers can be helpful to a hotel‚Äôs‚Äîor a management company‚Äôs‚Äîbottom lines.

Most airport-adjacent hotels in Real Hospitality Group‚Äôs portfolio have their own dedicated shuttles with dedicated drivers which makes it easier to control the guest experience than partnering with a third-party transportation company that runs shuttles on a set schedule. ‚ÄúAnd we can generally do it less expensive especially when we're doing it on-demand and not on a constant route‚Äù he added. Similarly if a guest feels that a third-party driver has been disrespectful a hotelier has limited options. ‚ÄúWhen I called our companies they were quick to offer a credit on our weekly invoices‚Äîbut that didn't help the customer.‚Äù Having disciplinary authority over drivers also makes it easier to solve any problems and mollify unhappy guests quickly.

Offering a free shuttle for airport passengers can get very expensive Seidel cautioned: ‚ÄúI don't know how necessary it is. It's going to vary market by market and be based on what the competitive landscape is for that service.‚Äù

Name: Ulta Beauty
Name_1: Free Samples Are Back But With Safety In Mind
Text_1:
When Pat Curry spotted bite-sized wood-fire rotisserie chicken with portabella mushroom at her local Costco in early June she felt ‚Äúgiddy.‚Äù After a 14-month hiatus free samples were back.

‚ÄúIt was one of the markers that told me that we turned a corner‚Äù said the 60-year-old who lives in Augusta Georgia. ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs the little things that you do that were taken away and now they‚Äôre back.‚Äù

When the pandemic was declared in March 2020 retailers worried about the potential spread of the coronavirus so they cut off free sampling of everything from food to makeup to toys. But now with vaccinations rolling out and the threat of COVID-19 easing in the U.S. stores like Costco are feeling confident enough to revive the longstanding tradition.

For customers sampling makes it fun to shop and discover new items ‚Äî not to mention getting all the freebies. For retailers they‚Äôre critical tools to keep shoppers coming back and battle against online retailers like Amazon.

Food sampling converts browsers into buyers at a 20% higher rate than if customers weren‚Äôt allowed to test says NPD Group Inc. a market research firm. The conversion rate is 30% higher when beauty products are sampled.

‚ÄúSampling is critical‚Äù said Marshal Cohen NPD‚Äôs chief industry analyst. ‚ÄúImpulse alone drives 25% of the retail business.‚Äù

Jake Tavello a senior vice president at Stew Leonard‚Äôs said promoting new items had been challenging without sampling a tradition started by his grandfather who founded the regional grocery chain in 1969. Sales of a new item pink glow pineapple were OK this past spring for example but have tripled since demonstrations were reintroduced.

‚ÄúWhen people taste it that‚Äôs what can makes people want to buy it and decide what they want to eat for dinner‚Äù Tavello said.

But while sampling is back it‚Äôs not clear if everyone is ready to bite. With that in mind some retailers are putting various safety protocols in place to ease any safety concerns.

At Costco masked workers prepare the hot and cold samples behind plexiglass counters and distribute to its members one at a time. Stew Leonard‚Äôs also brought back hot samples with similar safety measures.

Meanwhile Walmart and its wholesale club division Sam‚Äôs Club are only serving pre-sealed food samples. And Sam‚Äôs Club is limiting to sampling on the weekend. Target said that staffed food and beverage sampling has remained on pause since March 2020 but it has been allowing self-service sampling of individually wrapped items.

With beauty testing retailers appear to be even more cautious. Beauty chain Ulta Beauty said it‚Äôs still figuring out how to bring back makeup testers. Target said in May it will resume beauty product sampling in stores this year where customers can take home individually wrapped items. Kohl‚Äôs would only say that it hadn‚Äôt brought back makeup or fragrance sampling.

Lawrence Gostin a public health expert at Georgetown University said handling and eating food has not been a major route for the spread of COVID-19. But food sampling can lead to people congregating together and that increases the risk of transmission. He also pointed to concerns about food sampling that go beyond the coronavirus: ‚ÄúMultiple hands grabbing samples can lead to the spread of germs while contaminated gloves can also disperse unwanted bacteria.‚Äù

As for makeup testing Gostin said it‚Äôs ‚Äúmuch safer and wiser‚Äù to use samples that are fully packaged. And with letting kids play with toys frequent sanitizing of objects is recommended to contain viruses like influenza which unlike COVID-19 can be easily spread through touching contaminated surfaces.

Toy retailer Camp which centered its shopping experience around children playing with toys now has individually wrapped craft kits in the store instead of letting kids dig around for art supplies says Tiffany Markofsky the company‚Äôs marketing director. For testing out toys it‚Äôs sticking to items that can be easily cleaned like remote control toy cars instead of dolls with faux hair.

Marianne Szymanski president of Toy Tips Inc. a toy guide believes toy testing overall will be ‚Äúlimited‚Äù because of the lingering fears about germs due to the pandemic.

Some retailers are doing away with sampling altogether. For instance West Hollywood California-based beauty company Blushington isn‚Äôt reopening its six stores and is instead moving more toward virtual makeup sessions and offering services at shoppers‚Äô home says CEO Natasha Cornstein. She thinks shoppers believe they have better control of their environment and hygiene in their own home.

‚ÄúThe consumer is coming out of COVID with very different habits‚Äù she said. ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs not only about COVID now.‚Äù
Name_2: Citi Survey Shows Millennials Going Back to Work
Text_2:
As the world opens back up Millennial spenders are preparing to spend more money outside the home according to a recent survey from Citi.

The bank surveyed customers ahead of launching its most recent Custom Cash Card reporting that respondents‚Äô buying habits vary widely and have changed drastically in past months. And although beauty products don‚Äôt top the list of spending their activities bode well for the category ‚Äî with socializing travel and entertaining topping the list. ‚ÄúEight-two percent of respondents said that what they spend on varies month-to-month based on their various interests so on an individual level people want to live as they choose‚Äù said Pam Habner head of U.S. branded cards and lending at Citi.

More from WWD

Although consumers are still spending on quarantine-era hobbies and habits they are branching back into outdoor categories centered around human connection. ‚ÄùSeventy-two percent tried a new hobby this past year and those aren‚Äôt going away‚Äù Habner said. ‚ÄúSome of the ones getting the most buzz are streaming services because folks have gotten used to streaming all of their shows. Fitness clubs too as consumers can return to them are popular‚Äù she said.

The more outdoor-facing the category the better it is expected to fare Habner said. ‚ÄúFor Millennials the only constant is change. Spending patterns were upside down last year and some traditional categories were down during the pandemic like travel and dining. As the world is opening up again we‚Äôre seeing those return‚Äù she said.

Here the top five categories Millennials are planning to spend on.

Happy hours/socializing with their coworkers over food: 44 percent Going to live entertainment after work: 36 percent Traveling for work: 28 percent Running errands around the workday: 23 percent Group fitness classes around the workday: 19 percent

Name_3: Keys Soulcare Review: A Celebrity Skincare Line We're Actually Impressed With
Text_3:
If you buy something from the links on this page we may earn a commission. Why Trust Us?

Some products show up everywhere ‚Äî subway ads Instagram celeb endorsements. With this series we're testing such products to conclude one thing: Does it live up to the hype?

What‚Äôs everyone talking about?

 a line of skin and ‚Äúsoul‚Äù-soothing products by award-winning singer and A-list celeb Alicia Keys. The affordable skincare collection includes seven face products three body products a candle and a facial roller.

What‚Äôs the buzz about?

As of lately just about every celebrity (seriously every) has some form of beauty line collaboration or product that they're promoting. Though many of them don't live up to their hyped expectations we finally found a line of celeb-founded skincare that we can't get enough of: Keys Soulcare co-created by none other than famed crooner and soulful goddess Alicia Keys.

Keys Soulcare

Created alongside the beauty experts over at e.l.f. Cosmetics this line includes a total of 12 products to turn your usual skincare and shower routine into an indulgent ritual without the luxury price tag. Best of all every product in this line is less than $40. The curated take on elevated skincare basics (think cleansers moisturizers exfoliators and more) will make your skin and your soul feel zen and harmonious.



Where's all the hype coming from?

Rave reviews from major lifestyle publications like Allure Glamour and WhoWhatWear.

Over 112000 followers on the brand's Instagram alone.

Alicia Keys herself

So does it live up to the hype?

How‚Äôd we come to this conclusion?

I'm going to be fully transparent: Every time I see a new celebrity beauty launch I immediately eye roll. As much as I love a good beauty launch many of these new celeb-backed brands bring nothing entirely new to our vanities and contribute to the industry's undeniably shameful environmental impact.

But  the Alicia Keys-backed line of skincare products that are meant to nurture your skin and your soul has proven to be a rather impressive beauty gem that just so happens to be co-created by an A-list celebrity.

Keys Soulcare

Just about each and every product in this deliciously scented collection is as soothing as the next and it‚Äôs genuinely a brand that your complexion and your conscience can feel good about using. Inspired by Keys‚Äô own foray into skincare and love of ancient beauty rituals the singer teamed up with dermatologist Dr. Ren√©e Snyder to create a line of skincare products that are made with potent yet gentle ingredients. Dr. Snyder might sound familiar ‚Äî she also cofounded cult-favorite beauty brand  an award-winning cruelty-free and plant-powered mineral makeup line.

The brand axed restricted by the FDA and European Union Cosmetics Regulation Guidelines from the skincare collection and put a focus on fusing naturally-derived minerals and botanicals with modern skincare saviors like hyaluronic acid and ceramides. It is worth noting that most of the products (except for the fragrance-free version of the Skin Transformation Cream) do have fragrances and while we do love a good scent fragrances are known irritants to skin. So if you're sensitive to them you may want to skip most of the products in this brand.

Keys Soulcare

Of course what‚Äôs inside the bottle is important but there are also a few details that Keys intentionally placed outside of the formulas. The beauty brand is considered a ‚Äúsoul care‚Äù line for a reason: Keys wanted to highlight the connection between ‚Äúskin and soul‚Äù and wanted you to embrace your daily skincare routine as a calming ritual to start and end your day. Each recyclable glass package is labeled with a mantra to help you zen out bringing all of your senses to the forefront and allowing you to mentally chill TF out.

It all sounds amazing on paper but does it live up to its award-winning cofounder's name?

After slathering myself in every item in this line for thorough testing I can honestly say that I'm fairly impressed with most of the products from Keys Soulcare. If you're intrigued and want to learn more about each product here's some good news: I've ranked each and every product from Alicia Keys‚Äô beauty brand (minus the deliciously scented  for pretty obvious reasons) just for you.

I must warn you that I have very high standards when it comes to what I put on my skin so here are the criteria that I kept in mind while testing out Keys Soulcare:

What are the ingredients?

How does it feel on my skin?



Does it cause irritation?



Will it cause acne/breakouts?



Overall is it doing what it promises to do?

Below check out which products from Keys Soulcare made the cut into my heavily curated skincare routine and which ones fell short:

10. Keys Soulcare Obsidian Facial Roller

Overall Rating: 3/10

Keys Soulcare Keys Soulcare Obsidian Facial Roller Keys Soulcare Keys Soulcare Obsidian Facial Roller $25 at Ulta Beauty

This face roller is made from black obsidian which is a precious stone made out of quickly cooled lava that‚Äôs formed into volcanic glass ‚Äî pretty cool right? Its rotating head is meant to help you massage your facial muscles while allowing the product to get deeper into the skin creating a more sculpted lifted and overall healthier look to your complexion.



But I'm not going to lie ‚Äî this was the product I was most disappointed in. It just didn't have enough weight to it as most other facial rollers do and it doesn't stay cool like other ones I've tried as well. It's fun to use but unless you know how to properly use a facial roller at home (which you can find out here) you're not going to get much out of this product.

9. Keys Soulcare Rich Nourishing Body Cream

Overall Rating: 3.5/10

Keys Soulcare Keys Soulcare Rich Nourishing Body Cream Keys Soulcare Keys Soulcare Rich Nourishing Body Cream $36 at Ulta Beauty

This body cream is meant to give your skin head-to-toe hydration and a soothing treatment. It contains natural ingredients like hydrating shea butter cocoa butter ceramides calming oats and ‚ÄúRose of Jericho‚Äù a Mexican plant that the brand claims is great for hydrating parched skin.

When I opened up this giant tub of cream I expected a rich buttery texture that would glide right onto my skin. Unfortunately this cream was too thick almost like the consistency of a very sticky balm. It took forever just to seep into my skin and as I type this my legs are still sticking together from this cream about 2 hours after I applied it.

Yes it does have a great smell (which might be a red flag for sensitive skin) and my legs do feel hydrated but this formula is just way too sticky for my taste. From now on this cream is dedicated solely to the roughest parts of my skin: my knees and elbows and that's about it.

8. Keys Soulcare Reviving Aura Mist

Overall Rating: 5/10

Keys Soulcare Keys Soulcare Reviving Aura Mist Keys Soulcare Keys Soulcare Reviving Aura Mist $25 at Ulta Beauty$25 at Amazon

This face and body mist is meant to hydrate tone and revive your skin while you indulge yourself in the scent of rose and the cooling sensation of each and every spritz. Made with a mix of Rose of Jericho (clearly a favorite ingredient of the brand) and exfoliating witch hazel you should expect your skin to feel revitalized and awakened while it gently detoxes your pores of any congesting impurities.

This mist is nice but that's just about all I can say about it. It's not bad by any means ‚Äî it feels cool on the skin which makes it nice for getting through hot summer days it seeps into skin instantly and its scent is far from overwhelming.

But to be honest I rarely get excited about face mists because they don't really provide much beyond a light dose of hydration and a soothing feel. In fact if a face mist has a harsh ingredient like alcohol it can actually dry out your skin even more.

7. Keys Soulcare Sacred Body Oil

Overall Rating: 6/10



Keys Soulcare Keys Soulcare Sacred Body Oil Keys Soulcare Keys Soulcare Sacred Body Oil $25 at Ulta Beauty

This body oil is infused with botanically derived ingredients like marula baobab and jojoba oils to give your body a deep hydration treatment. This oil also includes clarifying sea buckthorn and moisturizing manuka honey to help clear your skin of any blemishes while making every inch of your body feel soft smooth and supple.

I will say that I genuinely enjoyed this body oil way more than the body cream. However I felt like it had the opposite problem: It's not as hydrating as I would like it to be. But I don't blame the brand because there's a very fine line between making a skincare oil that's too greasy and too dry and this one just missed that sweet spot. While the formula does seep into skin instantly instead of leaving my skin a slippery mess it just didn't give me that indulgent quenched feel that other body oils provide. After half an hour of applying it my arms actually felt like they could use a layer of lotion to rehydrate.

I'm sure you can counteract this feeling by putting more on but who wants to eat up all their product in one sitting like that? Also the dropper is very sensitive and it did drip a lot of oil on my floors so put a towel down before you apply.

6. Keys Soulcare Comforting Balm

Overall Rating: 7/10

Keys Soulcare Keys Soulcare Comforting Balm Keys Soulcare Keys Soulcare Comforting Balm $12 at Ulta Beauty

The name truly says it all with this product: This balm is meant to comfort hydrate and soothe the parts on your skin that need some extra love (think your elbows cuticles heels etc.). This lightweight and vanilla-scented balm is formulated with natural ingredients like hydrating camellia seed oil Rose of Jericho avocado oil and shea butter to treat your complexion to an instant dose of moisture when it needs it the most.

I have to say ‚Äî I really enjoyed this balm. It melted into my skin like butter it instantly seeped into the pores of the roughest parts of my body (especially my heels) and it left behind a velvety-smooth feel. Unlike other balms this one didn't leave a greasy feel on my skin which was a major plus in my book. I was able to put this balm on immediately step into my open-toed sandals and head out the door without any greasy feel messing up my steps.

The only reason why this balm isn't higher up on the list is because of how tiny the jar is albeit it is the cheapest product in the line. If the balm had come in the same jumbo size as the body cream it might've earned the top spot on this list.

5. Keys Soulcare Be Luminous Exfoliator

Overall Rating: 7.5/10

Keys Soulcare Keys Soulcare Be Luminous Exfoliator Keys Soulcare Keys Soulcare Be Luminous Exfoliator $25 at Ulta Beauty

This may be one of the gentlest exfoliators you could ever come across but that doesn't mean it won't perform. This powder-to-foam formula works its magic through potent ingredients like antioxidant-rich green tea gently exfoliating lactic acid and hojicha powder and texture-refining mung beans while soothing oats comfort your skin.

The Be Luminous Exfoliator is another one of my favorites from Keys Soulcare. I love the combination of exfoliating acids and gentle micro granules for gently washing away any dirt and debris on my complexion. I especially love that the micro granules are made out of naturally derived ingredients.

A little goes a long way with this exfoliant too. With just a teaspoon of the exfoliating powder I was able to scrub my face neck shoulders and chest! It also had a slight tingling feeling which I love since my skin can handle it but I'd recommend patch-testing first if you're more of a sensitive skin type.

Once I rinsed it off my skin did feel soft and supple but it did leave my skin a bit tight which is the main reason why it's earned the fifth spot on this list.

4. Keys Soulcare Golden Cleanser

Overall Rating: 7.5/10

This cleanser has a gel-like feel that turns into a deliciously foamy lather that feels calm and cool on the skin making it the perfect summer cleanser for relaxing sunburnt complexions. It contains ingredients like moisturizing manuka honey brightening turmeric and calming chamomile to give your skin a trifecta of benefits in just one wash.



I usually find gel cleansers to feel a little too drying on my skin but I really do like this cleanser. While this one did leave my skin feeling a little too squeaky-clean it wasn't nearly as severe as other cleansers. The smell is also amazing but again sensitive skin types should patch-test to make sure the fragrance won't cause any reactions.

Though it works like a charm when I'm cleansing on a minimal makeup day you may want to break out another cleanser if you're wearing a full face of makeup. After a day of my face coated in concealer contour blush and full eye makeup all I wanted was to rinse off my makeup immediately but alas ... the cleanser just couldn't cut through it all. I had to break out another oil cleanser to help rid my face of stubborn waterproof mascara so try opting for a more intensive cleanser if you wear a full face of makeup daily.

3. Keys Soulcare Renewing Body + Hand Wash

Overall Rating: 8/10

Keys Soulcare Keys Soulcare Renewing Body + Hand Wash Keys Soulcare Keys Soulcare Renewing Body + Hand Wash Now 50% Off $13 at Ulta Beauty

This dreamy gel cleanser lathers up and gives your skin a deep cleanse while hydrating it in the shower. This body and hand wash claim to pack on the moisture through its blend of shea butter cocoa butter and manuka honey plus it has the calming scent of sage and oat milk to transport you to an exotic getaway (even if you're just in your shower).

I‚Äôm obsessed with this body wash and it‚Äôs currently the only one I‚Äôm using at the moment. First off my shoulders and back are extremely prone to breaking out so I always approach new body washes with extreme caution. Thankfully this cleanser actually helped with my body acne and has made inflammation and redness a thing of the past which is perfect timing considering that it‚Äôs tank tops and bikinis season.

While it is supposed to be a hydrating body wash it did still leave my body feeling a bit dry out of the shower which is the only reason why it's earning spot #3.

2. Keys Soulcare Skin Transformation Cream (Fragrance-Free)

Overall Rating: 9/10



Keys Soulcare Keys Soulcare Skin Transformation Cream (Fragrance Free) Keys Soulcare Keys Soulcare Skin Transformation Cream (Fragrance Free) $8 at Ulta Beauty

While the of this gel-like cream is fragranced I opted to test out the fragrance-free version in order to not upset my sensitive currently acne-prone skin. Though you can't expect a whiff of sage and oat milk with this cream you'll definitely be pleasantly greeted with a surge of hydration via hydrating hyaluronic acid and ceramides. But those aren't the only ingredients you'll find in this cream. Your skin will also get a detox treatment from malachite and a burst of bakuchiol a retinol alternative that'll improve the tone and texture of your complexion without irritating it.

I usually don't vibe with gel moisturizers but this cream just made me a full convert to them. Its bouncy texture felt cool the second it touched my skin which helped calm down red patches and blemishes. Its rich-yet-airy texture left my skin feeling and looking dewy radiant and brighter without leaving a greasy film on my face like other moisturizers tend to do. The only reason why this moisturizer didn't earn the top spot is that I just love the number-one product that much!

1. Keys Soulcare Harmony Mask

Overall Rating: 10/10

Keys Soulcare Keys Soulcare Harmony Mask Keys Soulcare Keys Soulcare Harmony Mask $28 at Ulta Beauty

If you're a fan of charcoal masks then you absolutely need to give this one a try. This mask has the purifying powers of activated charcoal but it stands out from other face masks in the beauty aisle for its moisturizing properties which you can thank manuka honey for. And as an indulgent surprise this mask is also infused with gold foil which Cleopatra herself used every night to brighten her complexion.

Oh how I love this mask. It has that same detoxing feel as most charcoal-based face masks but one of the best things about it is that it won't leave your skin feeling stripped of all of its natural oils thanks to the hydrating manuka honey. Its formula has a cooling and creamy texture when I first applied it and as it dried down I noticed that the mask still had a bit of moisture in it making it much easier to move around my lips and face.

After wearing it for a full 10 minutes (you can wear it up to 20 minutes if you want a more intensive detox) I rinsed off the mask and my skin instantly felt plumped hydrated and cleansed. Most importantly it calmed down my breakouts so much that I decided to slather this mask on my shoulders and back to see if it would also help calm down my body acne and lo and behold ‚Äî it helped! This is definitely going to be a staple in my weekly skincare routine.

What‚Äôs the bottom line?

Though there are a few products that miss the mark but overall Keys Soulcare is one of the few celebrity beauty brands that I can actually vouch for. The clean formulas and sustainable packaging are major pluses and though I'm not a fan of every product on this list I'm definitely impressed and satisfied with how Alicia Keys brought this skin (and soul) soothing collection to life. The entire line may not take up my entire skin routine but expect to see a few Keys Soulcare products pop up in my #shelfies.

Follow BestProducts.com on Facebook Instagram Twitter and Pinterest!
